0.title: There are songs in 'Brahmastra' that I've hidden away from Alia: Ayan
0.article_body: 'Brahmastra' director Ayan Mukerji revealed there are songs that he has "hidden away" from actress Alia Bhatt. During an Instagram Live session, a fan asked Ayan about the number of songs his film has. To this, he replied, "I wouldn't like to reveal this at this time actually...There are songs (in Brahmastra) that I have hidden away even from Alia."

1.title: BJP MLA's aide slaps toll staffer in Rajasthan, incident caught on camera
1.article_body: BJP MLA Sanjay Sharma's aide has been caught on camera slapping a toll plaza staffer in Rajasthan's Dausa. The incident occurred after the toll worker asked for the MLA's identity card which reportedly infuriated the aide. Sharma remained seated inside the car as his aide emerged from the car and threatened the staffer before slapping him.

2.title: When given responsibility, Hardik is a completely different cricketer: Shastri
2.article_body: Ex-Team India head coach Ravi Shastri has said Hardik Pandya is a completely different cricketer when given extra responsibilities. "He was picked by Gujarat Titans, where he was given the extra responsibility of captaining, which did him a world of good," added Shastri. Hardik was named Team India captain in the two-match T20I series against Ireland, which India won 2-0.

3.title: How many times did Manmohan ji attend all-party meet?: BJP to Congress
3.article_body: Reacting to the criticism of Congress party over PM Narendra Modi's absence in the all-party meet held today, BJP's Pralhad Joshi said that before 2014 no PM used to attend all-party meet. "Congress's Jairam Ramesh raised issue that PM didn't attend the meeting today...How many times did Manmohan Singh ji attend the all-party meeting?" the Union Parliamentary Affairs Minister asked.

4.title: Delhi govt’s power subsidy is 'propaganda': Gautam Gambhir
4.article_body: East Delhi MP Gautam Gambhir said claims of power subsidy by the Delhi government are an eyewash as it comes from taxes paid by the people. "In the past eight years, people of Delhi have just been at the receiving end of propaganda and hogwash," Gambhir said. He added that private electricity companies collect around ₹20,000 crore every year.

5.title: Fire at Rajasthan vegetable market, dozen shops gutted; no casualties
5.article_body: A major fire broke out at a vegetable market in Rajasthan's Dholpur district on Saturday night. Reports said that a dozen shops were gutted in the fire. Several fire tenders reportedly reached the spot. However, the cause of the fire is yet to be ascertained. No casualties were reported in the incident.

6.title: CrPC Section 144 imposed in Kallakurichi after violence over girl's suicide
6.article_body: Prohibitory orders under CrPC Section 144 have been imposed in Tamil Nadu's Kallakurichi, Chinnasalem and Nainarpalayam taluka as violence broke out after a Class 12 girl died by suicide. In a note, the girl alleged that two teachers were torturing her. The School Education Department has asked Kallakurichi's Chief Education Officer to submit a detailed report on the incident.

7.title: Achieved it using our vaccines: VK Paul on crossing 200 cr COVID vaccination mark
7.article_body: As India crossed 200 crore COVID-19 vaccination mark, Niti Aayog’s Dr VK Paul said it's a magnificent milestone for the country. "We've achieved this using our own vaccines. All the credit for this achievement goes to people and leadership of the country," he added. Union Health Minister Mansukh Mandaviya said, “India has set...new record by completing target…in just 18 months."

8.title: I've been blocked from visiting Singapore to present Delhi Model: CM Kejriwal to PM
8.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal has written to PM Narendra Modi saying he's been "blocked" from visiting Singapore to present the 'Delhi Model' of governance before world leaders. The Lieutenant Governor reportedly hasn't responded to the visit request sent on June 7. Kejriwal said he's been invited by the Singapore government, adding, "[it's] a matter of pride for [India]...Kindly grant permission."

9.title: Delhi Police uses Kareena's K3G character Poo to stop traffic violations
9.article_body: The official Twitter handle of Delhi Police used actress Kareena Kapoor's character Poo from 2001 film 'Kabhi Khushi Kabhie Gham' to prevent people from jumping red lights. The video shows Poo as a red light saying her famous dialogue, "Kaun hai yeh, jisne dobara mudkar mujhe nahi dekha (Who is this, who didn't turn around to see me again)?"

10.title: Nadal, who pulled out of Wimbledon, set to resume training from Monday
10.article_body: Rafael Nadal is reportedly set to resume training from Monday in order to participate in the Canadian Open, which will begin on August 5 in Montreal. Nadal had pulled out of Wimbledon ahead of his semi-final due to an abdominal tear. "Nadal really wants to come to Montreal and his hotel rooms are already booked," said tournament director Eugene Lapierre.

11.title: Sindhu's coach responds to trolls saying she won Singapore Open as top players didn't play
11.article_body: PV Sindhu's coach Park Tae-sang took to Instagram to respond to trolls saying she won Singapore Open because top rankers didn't participate in the tournament. "That doesn't mean Sindhu's win is anything but light, Light to shine It doesn't matter who participates, who doesn't," he wrote. "Who can despise this win for her like that?" he further wrote.

12.title: 11 SEBI officials' email accounts hacked & used to send 34 emails, FIR filed
12.article_body: Mumbai police has filed an FIR after the Securities and Exchange Board of India (SEBI) approached them, alleging the email accounts of its 11 officials had been hacked and used to send as many as 34 emails by unknown persons. "It was a small incident. CERT-IN is fully in the loop. No sensitive data was lost," the markets regulator said.

13.title: I was told 'Be calculative; post more about work, less about parties': Janhvi
13.article_body: Actress Janhvi Kapoor revealed in an interview that she has been told being calculative and maintaining a certain image is necessary to succeed in Bollywood. The actress further said that she was also told to put more content on social media about work so it doesn't seem like she is "only doing yoga and partying and eating food".

14.title: Stunning performance: Anurag Thakur on Sindhu's 1st Singapore Open title
14.article_body: Sports Minister Anurag Thakur took to Twitter to praise PV Sindhu following her title win at Singapore Open on Sunday. "Stunning performance by Sindhu to clinch her first ever Singapore Open title...third title of 2022, she is looking in superb form!" Third seeded Sindhu defeated Wang Zhi Yi of China 21-9, 11-21, 21-15 in 58 minutes.

15.title: Fire breaks out in Pune's Hadapsar, 12 huts gutted; no casualties
15.article_body: Twelve huts were gutted in a fire that broke out in Pune's Hadapsar area in early hours of Sunday. Reports said that no casualties were reported in the incident. Fire brigade officials said that the control room received a call about the fire at 2:55 am. The fire was brought under control.

16.title: Haridwar schools to remain closed from July 20-26 amid Kanwar Yatra
16.article_body: The District Magistrate in Uttarakhand's Haridwar on Sunday announced a holiday for all schools and Anganwadi centres from July 20 to 26 due to the increasing number of devotees and the possibility of the closure of roads for the movement. The annual pilgrimage of Lord Shiva devotees began on July 14. It is taking place after two years.

17.title: Story of Bajrangi Bhaijaan 2 takes a 10-year leap: Vijayendra Prasad
17.article_body: Writer Vijayendra Prasad said the sequel to Salman Khan-starrer 'Bajrangi Bhaijaan' will be a continuation of the first part. "The story takes an eight to 10-year leap in 'Bajrangi Bhaijaan 2'. I'm hopeful...the sequel will be no lesser than the first part," he added. In an earlier interview, Kabir Khan said Salman chose 'Pawan Putra Bhaijaan' as the sequel's title.

18.title: Delhi man who killed family, self, lost crores in IPL betting: Police
18.article_body: Days after a 40-year-old man allegedly shot himself dead after killing his wife and two daughters over losses in his jeans business in Delhi, police found that the man was also debt-ridden. The man had lost crores of rupees after betting on Indian Premier League (IPL) cricket matches. The deceased had also sold some of his properties, police said.

19.title: India announce their playing XI for ODI series decider against England
19.article_body: Team India captain Rohit Sharma won the toss and elected to bowl first against England in the ODI series decider in Manchester. India have made one change to their playing XI, with Jasprit Bumrah being replaced by Mohammed Siraj. Rohit revealed during the toss that Bumrah is missing out from the match due to a back spasm.

20.title: India's 16-yr-old Praggnanandhaa wins Paracin Open chess title in Serbia
20.article_body: Indian Grandmaster R Praggnanandhaa won Paracin Open 'A' chess tournament in Serbia on Saturday, scoring eight points from nine rounds. The 16-year-old remained unbeaten and finished half a point ahead of top seed Alexandr Predke, who finished at second spot with 7.5 points. Praggnanandhaa drew the seventh round with Predke and the ninth and final round with Kazakhstan's Alisher Suleymenov.

21.title: NSA invoked against Prayagraj violence accused Javed Mohammad
21.article_body: The district administration in Uttar Pradesh's Prayagraj has invoked the National Security Act (NSA) against Javed Mohammad, one of the main accused in the June 10 violence in the city. The violence broke out during protests over suspended BJP spokesperson Nupur Sharma's remarks against Prophet Muhammad. Javed, who is a businessman, is currently lodged at the Deoria district jail.

22.title: Govt breaking hopes of crores of families by making youths unemployed: Rahul
22.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi criticised the BJP by tweeting a video of the SSC GD 2018 candidates protesting against the delay in their recruitment by marching for 800 kilometres before police stopped them in Agra. "People will be arrested for demanding their rights in 'New India'...Government is breaking the hopes of crores of families by making youths unemployed," Rahul tweeted.

23.title: PM absent during all-party meet, isn’t this 'unparliamentary'?: Cong's Jairam
23.article_body: As the government held an all-party meeting on Sunday, Congress' Jairam Ramesh said, “The PM was as usual absent”. “Isn’t this unparliamentary?” he tweeted. “Today in the all-party meeting many political parties...pointed out the contradiction in the [PM] Modi Sarkar claiming credit for its Presidential candidate...and killing off the Forest Rights Act, 2006 on the other hand!” he added.

24.title: Violence worries me, accused will be punished: TN CM on Kallakurichi violence
24.article_body: Reacting to the violent incidents which broke out in Tamil Nadu's Kallakurichi after a school girl committed suicide alleging torture by teachers, CM MK Stalin said, "Violence worries me." "Accused will be punished when the police probe ends. I have asked DGP, Home Secretary, to travel to Kallakurichi. I request people to maintain peace," he added.

25.title: She wasn't my mother's friend, gossip was spread by vested interests: Lalit Modi on Minal
25.article_body: Former IPL Chairman Lalit Modi, in an Instagram post, clarified that his late wife Minal Modi wasn't his mother's friend. "Departed love of my life Minal was my best friend for 12 years while she was married. She wasn't my mother's friend. That gossip was spread by vested interests," he wrote. Minal was nine years elder to Lalit.

26.title: Which household items will get costlier from tomorrow due to changes in GST rules?
26.article_body: Pre-packaged and labelled food items like curd, lassi and buttermilk will get costlier from July 18 as they'll attract 5% GST. Jaggery, khandsari sugar, puffed rice will no longer be exempt from GST. Kitchen utensils like knives, spoons, forks, and stationery items like pencil sharpeners, maps, globes and electrical appliances such as LED lights and fixtures will also get costlier.

27.title: FBI 'most wanted' drug lord with $20 mn reward on him captured, pic released
27.article_body: Infamous drug lord Rafael Caro Quintero, a leader in the Guadalajara cartel, has been captured after being traced by a search dog in Mexico. Quintero was added to the FBI's 10 'most wanted' criminals list in 2018 and a $20 million reward was announced for his capture. He allegedly terrorised and destabilised Mexico during his time in the cartel.

28.title: Ali Abbas Zafar to direct Hindi remake of 'The Transporter': Report
28.article_body: Filmmaker Ali Abbas Zafar will reportedly be directing the official Hindi remake of the 2002 Hollywood film 'The Transporter'. A source revealed that producer Vishal Rana has bought the rights of the Jason Statham-starrer from international studio EuropaCorp. "Vishal...approached Ali...who was...happy to come on board, not just as a director but also as a co-producer," the source added.

29.title: Violent protests outside TN school after student's suicide, school property burnt
29.article_body: Violent protests broke out in front of a school in Tamil Nadu's Kallakurichi district where a student had died by suicide, alleging torture by teachers. In a video shared by Times Now, the protestors can be seen trying to overturn a bus while school property can be seen burning. The student had named some teachers in her suicide note.

30.title: Ileana D'Cruz dating Katrina Kaif's brother Sebastien: Reports
30.article_body: Actress Ileana D'Cruz is in a relationship with UK-based model and Katrina Kaif's brother Sebastien Laurent Michel, according to reports. Sebastien and Ileana have reportedly been dating for about six months now. They both also went to attend Katrina's birthday celebration in Maldives, with Ileana sharing a picture with Sebastien, Katrina and Vicky Kaushal among others.

31.title: Babar breaks Kohli's record, becomes fastest Asian batter to reach 10,000 int'l runs
31.article_body: Pakistan captain Babar Azam on Sunday became the fastest Asian batter to reach 10,000 runs in international cricket, breaking Virat Kohli's record. The 27-year-old reached the 10,000-run mark during Pakistan's first innings in the first Test against Sri Lanka. Babar took 228 innings to reach the milestone. Kohli had set the previous record by taking 232 innings.

32.title: Dhoni trusted me to win games when I was 22, it was massive: Lungi Ngidi
32.article_body: South Africa pacer Lungi Ngidi has said it was "massive" for him when MS Dhoni backed him during his IPL debut in 2018 for CSK. "Having someone of Dhoni's calibre put his trust in me to win him games when I was 22 was massive," he stated. Ngidi further said that IPL taught him how to handle a "big crowd".

33.title: Club mistakenly delivers Chicken Curry to vegetarian family in MP; fined ₹20,000
33.article_body: A fine of ₹20,000 was imposed on the restaurant of Madhya Pradesh's Jiwaji Club after it mistakenly delivered Chicken Curry to a vegetarian family who had placed an order for Matar Paneer online. The complainant, who is a member of the Jiwaji Club, alleged that he took the matter to the consumer forum as the club took no action.

34.title: To accuse Patel 20 months after his death is part of vendetta: Chidambaram
34.article_body: Reacting to accusations of conspiracy over the 2002 Gujarat riots against late Congress leader Ahmed Patel, party leader P Chidambaram said that to accuse Patel of conspiracy, 20 months after his death, is a "part of a vendetta" against a political opponent. "To allege that Ahmed Patel acted at the instance of Sonia Gandhi is vile and vengeful," Chidambaram tweeted.

35.title: It's true 'Rocky...' is delayed, still have song to shoot: Karan Johar
35.article_body: Karan Johar has confirmed the reports that 'Rocky Aur Rani Ki Prem Kahani' has been delayed. "It's true we're delayed. I...have a song to shoot. We were meant to shoot it this month...there were location issues in Europe," he stated. Karan added, "Now, Alia (due to her pregnancy) won't be able to shoot until February 2023. We'll shoot...after her delivery."

36.title: Urdu is not a religion specific language: TRS' KT Rama Rao
36.article_body: TRS Working President KT Rama Rao said that Urdu is not a religion specific language but regretfully some ignorants are trying to give such an impression. He further criticised BJP government and said that on one hand Centre is releasing funds for promotion of Urdu and on the other hand BJP leaders are indulging in misleading propaganda against the language.

37.title: Air India Express flight to Dubai diverted to Muscat due to burning smell in cabin
37.article_body: An Air India Express flight travelling from Calicut to Dubai on Saturday was diverted to Muscat as a burning smell was detected from the cabin mid-air. As per the Directorate General of Civil Aviation officials, the burning smell was coming from one of the vents in the forward galley. They added that the DGCA is investigating the incident.

38.title: Akshay & Emraan-starrer 'Selfiee' to release on Feb 24, 2023
38.article_body: Akshay Kumar and Emraan Hashmi-starrer 'Selfiee' will receive a theatrical release on February 24, 2023. The film is an official remake of the 2019 Malayalam film 'Driving Licence', which featured Prithviraj Sukumaran and Suraj Venjaramoodu. 'Selfiee' also features Diana Penty and Nushrratt Bharuccha. Akshay and Emraan will be sharing screen space in a film for the first time.

39.title: Bus collides with truck in UP's Rampur; 6 dead, 21 injured
39.article_body: A bus collided head-on with a truck in Uttar Pradesh's Rampur district. Six people died on the spot, out of which four have been identified as Shamimul Haq (35), Naseem Khan (52), Abdul Wahid (50) and Sakshi (26), police said. Notably, 21 others are seriously injured and have been admitted to the district hospital, police added.

40.title: A fighter to the core: Mahindra praises PV Sindhu after she wins Singapore Open
40.article_body: Businessman Anand Mahindra took to Twitter to praise PV Sindhu after she won the Singapore Open. Sharing a tweet by Doordarshan Sports which had an old image of Sindhu, Mahindra wrote, "That’s not just her facial expression, but the expression of her soul. A fighter to the core...Never getting demoralised by a slump. Teaching us how to rise again."

41.title: My mindset is the same in ODIs like it is in T20Is: Suryakumar Yadav
41.article_body: India's Suryakumar Yadav has said he tries to play his natural game irrespective of the format. "My mindset is the same in ODIs, I try to bat similar to how I do in T20Is...Even if the wickets are falling, I try to keep the scoreboard ticking," he stated. India will play the third and final ODI against England on Sunday.

42.title: India creates history again: PM Modi on crossing 200 cr COVID vaccination mark
42.article_body: As India crossed 200 crore COVID-19 vaccination mark, Prime Minister Narendra Modi said that India has created history again. "Congrats to all Indians on crossing special figure of 200 crore vaccine doses. Proud of those who contributed to making India's vaccination drive unparalleled in scale and speed. This has strengthened global fight against COVID-19," a tweet by Prime Minister read.

43.title: Violence erupts after meat pieces thrown inside a temple in UP
43.article_body: Violence erupted in Uttar Pradesh's Kannauj district after some unidentified miscreants allegedly threw pieces of meat in the compound of a village temple. Idols were also allegedly desecrated at two places, which led to protests during which several shops were set on fire, police said. DM Rakesh Mishra said two FIRs had been registered in connection with the incidents.

44.title: Only 10% of Delhi's population got booster doses: CM Kejriwal
44.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal urged people to get booster doses amid rising concerns over fresh surge in COVID-19 cases and said that only 10% of Delhi's population have got it so far. "I appeal to all eligible citizens to take 'precaution dose' of COVID vaccine, provided for free in Delhi. It will also be administered at mohalla clinics," he said.

45.title: Hold discussions on issues in interest of country: LS Speaker to leaders
45.article_body: Lok Sabha Speaker Om Birla on Saturday appealed to leaders of all political parties to hold discussions on key issues in the interest of the country. "The monsoon session will begin on 18th July and it will conclude on 12th August," Birla added. The Lok Sabha Speaker chaired the meeting of leaders of all political parties on Saturday.

46.title: How a startup should operate: Mahindra on old video of Man City's 44-pass goal
46.article_body: Businessman Anand Mahindra took to Twitter to share a 2018 video of Manchester City's 44-pass goal against Manchester United and wrote, "A lesson in teamwork...But also an analogy for how a startup...needs to operate." He further said that success comes from going "back and forth, trying new angles of approach and going for the kill when strategic path is clear".

47.title: Growth of franchise cricket is impacting international calendar: PCB
47.article_body: Ahead of the announcement of the next cycle of the Future Tours Programme (FTP), the Pakistan Cricket Board (PCB) said it has asked the ICC to devise a way to regulate the growing T20 leagues. "The growth of franchise cricket is impacting the already-crammed international cricket calendar...[we're] concerned about this development," PCB chief executive Faisal Hasnain said in a statement.

48.title: 3-year-old girl falls into toilet pit, dies in Pune village
48.article_body: A three-year-old girl fell into a toilet pit and died in Pune's Koregaon Khurd village. The deceased, Gatha Nitin Kaduskar, was playing near a pit construction site, which was filled with rainwater due to incessant rainfall, locals said. Villagers rescued the girl after finding her toys near the pit but later, she was pronounced dead at the hospital.

49.title: Mumbai Police arrest 28-yr-old man for sexually assaulting teenager last yr
49.article_body: A man was arrested for allegedly sexually assaulting a 14-year-old boy in Mumbai's Mulund in July 2021. The accused, Sunil Badarage (28), went absconding after allegedly assaulting the victim in a public bathroom, police said. Notably, a similar offence in another case has also been registered against Badarage at the Shrinagar Police Station in Thane, police added.

50.title: 7 held in Delhi for cheating people on pretext of redeeming credit card points
50.article_body: Seven people were arrested by the Delhi Police for allegedly defrauding people on the pretext of either redeeming credit card points or increasing credit card limit. An accused, Pulkit (23), disclosed that he runs a call centre with three women for this purpose from his home, police said. The other accused are Rahul (22), Avinash (37) and Jitender (28).

51.title: 6 of top 10 most valued firms lost ₹1.68 lakh crore in m-cap last week
51.article_body: Among the 10 most valued firms, six companies suffered a combined loss of ₹1.68 lakh crore in their market valuation last week. While TCS took the biggest hit as its market valuation declined by ₹99,270.07 crore to reach ₹10,95,355.32 crore, it was followed by Infosys, whose valuation dropped by ₹35,133.64 crore to ₹6,01,900.14 crore.

52.title: Presidential poll isn't a contest between 2 individuals but ideologies: Sinha
52.article_body: Ahead of the Presidential election, Opposition’s Presidential candidate Yashwant Sinha said this year the Presidential election is not a contest between two individuals but two ideologies. "Only one side wants to protect the provisions and values enshrined in our Constitution. I appeal to all MPs and MLAs to vote according to the Constitution and their conscience this time," he added.

53.title: Kashmiri Pandits welcome Hajj pilgrims with aarti in Srinagar, video surfaces
53.article_body: Dozens of Kashmiri Pandits welcomed the first batch of Hajj pilgrims with 'aarti' at the Srinagar airport on their return from Saudi Arabia, reports said. A video of incident was shared by Free Press Journal. 145 pilgrims were received by the local pandits with 'aarti' which was accompanied by 'Naat' (Praises of Prophet of Islam) at the airport on Saturday.

54.title: Awesomely outrageous roller-coaster: 'Doctor Strange' director on RRR
54.article_body: Hollywood filmmaker Scott Derrickson, known for directing the 2016 film 'Doctor Strange', has said that he "loved" SS Rajamouli's 'RRR'. Taking to Twitter, he wrote, "To celebrate my birthday last night, my wife, kids and I watched 'RRR', what an awesomely outrageous roller-coaster of a movie. Loved it." The film also featured Ram Charan and Jr NTR.

55.title: Shamshera made for masses, this was something forgotten in B'wood: Sanjay
55.article_body: Actor Sanjay Dutt has said that his upcoming film 'Shamshera' is made for the masses. "'Shamshera' is an amazing film, the most commercial film I have come across in recent times...This is the kind of work I've done all my life, but it got somewhere forgotten in Bollywood," he added. The film also features Ranbir Kapoor and Vaani Kapoor.

56.title: Mumbai civic body converting asphalt roads into concrete to fix pothole problem
56.article_body: The Mumbai civic body, Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC), has launched a mission to convert the asphalt roads in the city into cement-concrete (CC) ones in a move to rid them of potholes. Of the 2,055 km road network in Mumbai, the BMC has already converted more than 50% of asphalt roads into cement concrete ones, a senior official said.

57.title: India crosses 2 billion COVID-19 vaccination mark
57.article_body: More than 2 billion doses of COVID-19 vaccination have been administered in India, 18 months after vaccinations began in the country on 16 January 2021. According to CoWIN data, this includes 1,01,90,73,891 first vaccination doses and 92,59,26,880 second vaccination doses. As many as 5,50,14,860 precaution doses have also been administered.

58.title: Factory manager rapes 15-yr-old employee with wife's help, makes her drink acid in Delhi
58.article_body: A 31-year-old manager of a factory allegedly raped a 15-year-old girl who worked under him in Delhi, following which Delhi Commission for Women issued a notice to Delhi Police. The accused allegedly raped her with his wife's help, police said. The girl's father said the accused forcibly made her drink acid days after the crime.

59.title: It is not a sacrifice at all: Bill Gates on plan to give away all his wealth
59.article_body: Microsoft Co-founder Bill Gates, who plans to give away all his wealth, said, "My giving this money is not a sacrifice at all." He added, "I feel privileged to be involved in tackling these great challenges...and I believe I have an obligation to return my resources to society." Gates is currently the world's fourth richest person with $113 billion wealth.

60.title: BCCI had ₹40 cr in bank when I joined & ₹47,680 cr when I was banned: Lalit
60.article_body: In an Instagram post, Lalit Modi asserted that he neither took any government favour nor any bribes from anyone. He added, “I was born with a diamond spoon...When I joined BCCI, it had ₹40 crore in the bank. I joined on my birthday on November 29, 2005. Guess what was in the bank when I was banned - ₹47,680 crore."

61.title: PV Sindhu beats China's Wang Zhi Yi to win Singapore Open, bags her 3rd title of 2022
61.article_body: PV Sindhu on Sunday won the Singapore Open title after defeating China's Wang Zhi Yi 21-9, 11-21, 21-15 in the final. It is Sindhu's third title victory of the year. The 27-year-old became the second Indian woman badminton player to win Singapore Open. Saina Nehwal had become the first Indian woman shuttler to win Singapore Open in 2010.

62.title: I hold nothing against anyone: Lungi Ngidi on De Kock not taking a knee
62.article_body: Talking about his teammate Quinton de Kock's decision to not take a knee during the 2021 T20 World Cup, South Africa pacer Lungi Ngidi said, "I hold nothing against anyone." Ngidi added, "Everyone in the team has their own personal reasons...[and] the guys who made that decision [of not taking the knee] had given us their reasons."

63.title: Lalit shares pics with PM Modi & others amid trolling, says 'was born with diamond spoon'
63.article_body: While criticising people trolling him over his relationship with Sushmita Sen, Lalit Modi shared old pictures with PM Narendra Modi, Amit Shah, UK Prince Charles, Dalai Lama, Nelson Mandela among other personalities. He said he doesn't care about people calling him a fugitive, adding, "I was born with a 'diamond spoon'. I didn't take a bribe or ever needed to."

64.title: Our focus is to bring India to world through our stories: Joe Russo
64.article_body: Director Joe Russo has said that India has a "strong and fantastic film business" just like the US. "It's sadly not broken through on an international level consistently," he added. Joe further said that it is his and his brother Anthony Russo's "special focus" to bring some of the Indian talent and India to the world through their stories.

65.title: Is word ‘revari’ unparliamentary, asks Akhilesh Yadav
65.article_body: SP chief Akhilesh Yadav on Saturday asked, "Is the word ‘revari’ unparliamentary?" His statement came as PM Narendra Modi, after inaugurating Bundelkhand Expressway in UP, cautioned people against "revari (sweet) culture". "If those in power, running the ‘thank you’ campaign after distribution of 'revaris', could focus on giving jobs to youth, they could avoid 'culture of blaming'," Yadav tweeted.

66.title: With Eng ODI series on line, I don't think India will make many changes: Vaughan
66.article_body: Ex-England captain Michael Vaughan has said he won't be surprised if India go with the same side in the ODI series decider against England on Sunday. "Old Trafford is not that place where it swings...You have to hit the pitch hard. I don't think India will make many changes," he stated. India had lost the second ODI by 100 runs.

67.title: Rainfall lashes several parts of Delhi, minimum temperature drops to 26.4°C
67.article_body: Rain lashed several parts of Delhi on Saturday, causing temperature to decrease. Reports said Safdarjung station recorded a maximum temperature of 36.5 degrees Celsius, while the minimum was 28.3 degrees Celsius. Meanwhile, at Lodhi Road, minimum temperature dropped to 26.4 degrees Celsius. Maximum on Friday was 38.5 degrees Celsius, reports added. Rainfall was also witnessed in city on Sunday.

68.title: Karnataka will be malaria-free by 2025: State Health Minister
68.article_body: Karnataka Health Minister K Sudhakar said that the central government has given a target of eradicating malaria by 2030 but the state government has taken it as a challenge to make the state malaria-free by 2025. The government requires the support of non-governmental organisations and the public in addition to government programmes to fulfil this motive, he said.

69.title: You all call me fugitive, which court has ever convicted me: Lalit Modi
69.article_body: Lalit Modi on Sunday took to Instagram to speak about various issues after he revealed his relationship with Sushmita Sen. He wrote, "[Though you all] call me a "fugitive"...tell me which court has ever convicted me...None…Everyone knows how difficult it is to do business in India." Speaking about IPL, he said, “Everyone...knows that I did it all alone"

70.title: Instead of post-retirement ambitions, judges should serve nation: Gehlot
70.article_body: Judges and bureaucrats should work to serve the country rather than be concerned about their post-retirement ambitions, Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot said on Saturday. He added that if someone becomes an MLA, a CM, an MP or a judge, then he gets a chance to serve the country and should be proud of doing it.

71.title: Lalit Modi reacts to 'trolling' over relation with Sushmita, calls media 'obsessed'
71.article_body: Reacting to being trolled for tagging a wrong account while confirming his relationship with Sushmita sen, Lalit Modi said, "Why is the media so obsessed about trolling me?" "I guess we are still living in the Middle Ages that two people can't be friends & then if chemistry is right & timing is good- Magic can happen," he added.

72.title: Man starts thinking of having kids when he's nearing 40: Ranbir
72.article_body: Actor Ranbir Kapoor, speaking about the thought of having children, said, "This...happens when a man is nearing 40." He added, "You start thinking these things also, that 'when my child will be 20, I will be 60. Will I be able to play any sports, do things, go on any trek?'" Ranbir's wife Alia Bhatt announced her pregnancy in June.

73.title: IndiGo not following maintenance procedures, technicians tell Airbus; airline replies
73.article_body: IndiGo's technicians have written a letter to aircraft manufacturer Airbus complaining that the airline is not following standard maintenance procedures leading to risking passengers' safety. They said the technical staff has been on a strike for a couple of days and the airline is operating flights without proper maintenance. Meanwhile, IndiGo denied the allegations, calling them "baseless".

74.title: Man rescued from B'luru tracks just before train arrives, video surfaces
74.article_body: The Ministry of Railways has shared a video of Railway Police Force personnel rescuing a man from railway tracks in Bengaluru's KR Puram Railway Station. In the video, the man can be seen stuck on the track. A police personnel can be seen running towards him and rescuing him just seconds before the train crosses the track.

75.title: Horseman dies while saving Amarnath pilgrim from falling down a cliff
75.article_body: A 22-year-old Kashmiri horseman died while trying to save an Amarnath pilgrim from falling down a cliff. As per the horseman Imtiyaz's relatives, he was walking his horse when he realised that the pilgrim was sleeping and seemed to be falling over. Imtiyaz rushed to wake the pilgrim up during which he lost his balance and fell down, they said.

76.title: How is Dhankhar 'Kisan Putra', when he was sleeping during farmers' protests: TMC
76.article_body: Soon after BJP announced West Bengal Governor Jagdeep Dhankhar as NDA's Vice Presidential candidate and called him a "Kisan Putra" (son of a farmer), TMC said Dhankhar was sleeping during farmers' agitation. "Those who just tweet on issues...cannot be for people. When there was farmers’ agitation, Dhankhar was sleeping, how can he be Krishi Putra," TMC MP Santanu Sen said.

77.title: Don't want statue in Rashtrapati Bhavan, we're electing President: Tejashwi
77.article_body: RJD's Tejashwi Yadav on Saturday said, "We don't want any statue in Rashtrapati Bhavan, we're electing President." Furthermore, he said, "You must have...heard [of] Yashwant Sinha but we have never heard of the Presidential candidate of the ruling party. She hasn't held a single press conference since she became a candidate." Earlier, NDA announced Droupadi Murmu as its Presidential candidate.

78.title: 7-time Olympic gold medallist Felix ends career with 19th World C'hips medal
78.article_body: American athlete Allyson Felix ended her career with a 19th World Championships medal as the US team won bronze in the 4x400m mixed relay in the ongoing World Athletics Championships. Felix won 11 Olympic medals, including seven gold medals, in her career. She won silver in the 200m in the Athens Olympics at the age of 18.

79.title: On what criteria BJP chose Dhankhar as Vice Presidential candidate?: TMC MP
79.article_body: TMC MP Saugata Roy asked, "On what criteria did BJP choose West Bengal Governor Jagdeep Dhankhar as their candidate for Vice Presidential election?" Furthermore, he said, "Everyone thought that a minority candidate would be chosen for the Vice Presidential election by BJP but the party made it clear once and for all that they are not interested in the same."

80.title: Who are the highest-paid FMCG CEOs in India in FY22?
80.article_body: Marico’s MD and CEO Saugata Gupta emerged as the highest-paid FMCG CEO as his total pay in FY22 jumped by 157% from ₹14.03 crore in FY21 to ₹36.1 crore in FY22. Gupta is followed by HUL's Sanjiv Mehta at ₹22 crore salary, Nestle's Suresh Narayanan (₹18.80 crore), Dabur India's Mohit Malhotra (₹14.60 crore) and ITC's Sanjiv Puri (₹12.59 crore).

81.title: 2 men arrested for reciting Hanuman Chalisa in UP's Lulu mall amid namaz controversy
81.article_body: Police in Uttar Pradesh's Lucknow arrested two persons and detained a few others for reciting Hanuman Chalisa inside the newly opened Lulu mall. This comes after controversy over a viral video of a group of people offering namaz inside the mall. Earlier, the mall authorities had put up a sign, stating religious prayers were not allowed inside the mall.

82.title: Not delusional, got attention because of who my parents are: Janhvi
82.article_body: Actress Janhvi Kapoor has said she knows that the attention and recognition that has come her way is because of who her parents are. Janhvi, who is the daughter of producer Boney Kapoor and late actress Sridevi, added, "There's a lot of clarity...I'm not delusional and thinking that I've earned all of it or I deserve any of it even."

83.title: India records 20,528 new COVID-19 cases; list of state-wise active cases released
83.article_body: India has reported 20,528 COVID-19 cases and 49 related deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. The list released by the ministry shows West Bengal has the highest active COVID-19 cases at 30,613. This is followed by 24,645 active cases in Kerala, 17,228 in Tamil Nadu and 15,521 in Maharashtra.

84.title: Akshay & Suniel's 'Mohra' was a risky film with new faces: Director
84.article_body: Filmmaker Rajiv Rai said his 1994 film 'Mohra' was a risky film with new faces. "I thought Suniel Shetty...Akshay Kumar fit the part," he further added. Rajiv revealed late actress Divya Bharti, who he introduced in Bollywood with the film 'Vishwatma', was keen on doing the film. However, Raveena Tandon signed the film after things with Divya didn't work out.

85.title: India ranks 24th at International Mathematical Olympiad, wins 6 medals
85.article_body: India ranked 24th out of 104 countries at International Mathematical Olympiad held in Norway from July 6 to July 16, 2022. The team has won one gold and five bronze medals. Pranjal Srivastava from Bengaluru has scored hat-trick with his third consecutive gold medal at IMOs and is the only Indian to have won three golds at the event.

86.title: Who would've thought Indian-origin man could be UK PM: Zerodha Co-founder on Rishi Sunak
86.article_body: Zerodha Co-founder Nikhil Kamath took to Twitter to share a picture with the UK's former Finance Minister Rishi Sunak, who is one of the contenders for the post of UK Prime Minister. "Who would have thought 75 years ago on August 15, 1947, an Indian origin man could be the Prime Minister of Britain one day," Kamath wrote on Twitter.

87.title: 1st prototype train of Mumbai Metro 3 expected to arrive in Aug: MMRC chief
87.article_body: The trial run of underground Metro 3 (Colaba-Bandra-SEEPZ) will begin soon with the arrival of the prototype rake in August, Mumbai Metro Rail Corporation Limited's (MMRCL) MD Ashwini Bhide said. The trial run would be conducted inside the 3-km underground Marol-Maroshi station, and a temporary parking set-up nearby, she said. The prototype rake will cover 2,000 kilometres during trial run.

88.title: 3 arrested in Delhi for running extortion racket with China-based gang
88.article_body: Three people were arrested by the Delhi Police for allegedly working with a China-based gang to extort money on the pretext of short-term loans. The suspects are identified as Ravi Pankaj (28), Javed Ansari (30) and Vikas Yadav (19). Notably, last month, a complainant alleged that she was threatened by agents despite returning the loan amount on time, police said.

89.title: Jagdeep Dhankhar’s image is of Guv who rules hearts of people: Nadda
89.article_body: West Bengal Governor Jagdeep Dhankhar’s image has been of a Governor who rules the hearts of the people, BJP chief JP Nadda said. His statement came as he announced that Dhankhar is NDA’s candidate for the post of the Vice President of India. "Shri Dhankhar Ji is the son of a simple farmer family," Nadda added.

90.title: 20-yr-old Pune man steals vehicles to take girlfriend for joyrides, held
90.article_body: The Pimpri-Chinchwad Police have arrested a 20-year-old man for allegedly stealing motorcycles and four-wheelers for taking his girlfriend for joyrides. The accused has been identified as Yash Kiran Solse. The police have recovered 13 motorcycles and two four-wheelers worth ₹3,45,000 from the accused. The incident came to light after police found him during night patrolling.

91.title: Withdraw GST on healthcare services: IMA writes letter to Finance Minister
91.article_body: The Indian Medical Association (IMA) has written a letter to Union Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman requesting to exempt healthcare services from GST. Citing various recommendations by the 47th GST Council on certain facilities that were earlier exempted from GST and will be taxed post-July 18, IMA said the cost "will add a significant additional cost to the healthcare of people."

92.title: IndiGo flight to Hyderabad lands in Pakistan after pilot finds defect in plane
92.article_body: IndiGo's Sharjah-Hyderabad flight was diverted to Pakistan's Karachi after the pilot observed technical defect in the aircraft, which is being examined at the airport, the airlines said. "An additional flight is being sent to Karachi to fly the passengers to Hyderabad," it added. This comes days after Delhi-Dubai flight made an emergency landing in Karachi after developing a technical fault.

93.title: Rohit has shown a lot of confidence in me, I'd like to pay back: Suryakumar
93.article_body: India batter Suryakumar Yadav said captain Rohit Sharma has helped him a lot with his batting since his domestic cricket days. "Rohit has shown a lot of confidence in me...[and] the way things are going, I would like to pay back that confidence by scoring runs," he stated. Suryakumar slammed a century in the third T20I against England.

94.title: Unknown miscreants open fire at lorry driver in Hyderabad's ORR area
94.article_body: Some unknown miscreants opened fire at a lorry driver, who was carrying iron and steel, in the Outer Ring Road (ORR) area of Hyderabad. The driver Manoj Yadav was coming from Telangana's Chandapur and going towards Kochi in Kerala. In the incident, the front cabin glass of the lorry was damaged, however, the driver did not sustain any bullet injury.

95.title: Bride, family take boats as heavy rains flood roads in Andhra; pics go viral
95.article_body: A bride and her family took boats to the groom's house amid flooded roads due to heavy rainfall in Andhra Pradesh's Konaseema district. Videos and pictures of the wedding party are going viral on social media. The State Disaster Response Force mobilised a team to help them with the boats and reach the venue, according to reports.

96.title: Murali Sreeshankar finishes 7th in 1st men's long jump final for India at World C'hips
96.article_body: Long jumper Murali Sreeshankar finished seventh in the first-ever men's long jump final for India in the World Athletics Championships history. The 23-year-old registered a best jump of 7.96m to finish seventh. China's Jianan Wang won gold medal with a best jump of 8.36m, while Miltiadis Tentoglou of Greece won silver medal with an 8.32m jump.

97.title: Industry makes you stone, drills into you to seek your benefit: Neetu
97.article_body: Actress Neetu Chandra, speaking about the film industry, has said, "This industry makes you a stone; it drills into you to only seek your own benefit." She added there were times when she felt unwanted despite "doing so much". Neetu further stated, "I always say physical strength leads to mental strength and good mental health...it's...important to speak about mental health."

98.title: Badrinath-Rishikesh National Highway closed due to heavy landslide in U'khand
98.article_body: The Badrinath-Rishikesh National Highway near Khankra in Uttarakhand has been closed due to a heavy landslide in the area, news agency ANI reported. Earlier, the national highway to Badrinath had been closed due to landslides at Kuchda Nullah. Meanwhile, the Badrinath Highway had also been blocked recently due to falling boulders after overnight rainfall in the area.

99.title: Video of bridge painted like chess board in TN surfaces, Twitter users react
99.article_body: Chennai's iconic Napier bridge has been painted in white and black checks to appear like a chess board, ahead of the Chess Olympiad 2022, which will begin on July 28. Tamil Nadu government official and IAS officer Supriya Sahu shared a video of the bridge. Many Twitter users talked about potential accidents on the bridge due to the 'visual illusion'.

100.title: Cong shifts 5 of its Goa MLAs to Chennai ahead of Presidential polls
100.article_body: The Goa Congress has shifted five of its eleven MLAs to Chennai for the weekend ahead of the Presidential elections on July 18. MLAs Sankalp Amonkar, Yuri Alemao, Altone D'Costa, Rodolfo Fernandes and Carlos Alvares Ferreira were moved to Chennai on Friday evening. On Friday, state Congress President Amit Patkar accused the BJP of trying to lure Congress legislators.

101.title: Free education, healthcare are for making India number 1: Kejriwal
101.article_body: Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal on Saturday said his government's programmes of free education, electricity and healthcare were not "freebies" but were part of his plans to make India the world's number one country. His remarks came as earlier in the day Prime Minister Narendra Modi warned the people against the "revadi culture" of offering freebies in exchange for votes.

102.title: Kohli to take break from cricket, to stay in London after England series: Reports
102.article_body: Ex-Team India captain Virat Kohli will take a break from cricket and will stay back in London after the conclusion of the ongoing series against England, as per reports. Kohli will completely avoid cricket and will be joined by his mother and extended family during the break, reports added. Kohli hasn't been included in India's squad for West Indies tour.

103.title: 31 killed, 39 injured in ethnic clashes in Sudan
103.article_body: At least 31 people were killed and 39 others were injured in tribal clashes in a southern province of Sudan on Saturday. The Hausa and Birta ethnic groups fought over the killing of a farmer earlier this week and the violence continued despite deployment of troops. Sudan has been marred by ethnic clashes since last year's military coup.

104.title: Coronavirus lockdown extended in China's Macao
104.article_body: China's gambling enclave Macao extended its COVID-19 lockdown by another five days on Saturday as it battles one of the biggest virus outbreaks in two years. Now industries and commercial companies will remain closed until July 23 and all dine-in services have been suspended. Macao has reported around 1,700 infections since June 18 and is in lockdown since July 11.

105.title: He has to fight with himself and get things in order: Kapil Dev on Kohli
105.article_body: Commenting on Virat Kohli's poor form, Kapil Dev said a great player like him shouldn't take so much time to get back in form. "He has to fight with himself...get things in order," he added. Kapil further said Kohli might have been dropped or rested from T20I series against West Indies but there's a lot of cricket left in him.

106.title: New pic taken by world's most powerful telescope shows Jupiter with its rings & Moons
106.article_body: NASA has released an image of Jupiter taken from the James Webb Space Telescope, the world's most powerful space telescope. The image by the Webb Space Telescope shows the distinct ring around the planet and some of its Moons. The telescope captured the image using its Near Infrared Camera (NIRCam) filter.

107.title: A good man exits: Jairam Ramesh on outgoing VP Venkaiah Naidu
107.article_body: After BJP announced Jagdeep Dhankhar as NDA's candidate for Vice Presidential election, Congress General Secretary Jairam Ramesh said outgoing VP Venkaiah Naidu's humour and wit will be missed. "On many occasions [Naidu] got the Opposition all agitated...but at the end of it a good man exits," Ramesh said, adding, "He may have retired, but I know he'll not be tired."

108.title: Dhankhar's experience would be of great value for RS: Jaishankar
108.article_body: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar congratulated Jagdeep Dhankhar on Saturday after the latter was nominated as NDA's candidate for the Vice President of India's post. The minister wrote on Twitter, "His great erudition and rich experience would be of immense value for the functioning of the Rajya Sabha." Dhankhar is the current Governor of West Bengal.

109.title: Islam in China must be Chinese in orientation: Prez Xi
109.article_body: During his visit to Xinjiang this week, China's President Xi Jinping asked officials to step up efforts to uphold the principle that Islam in China must be Chinese in orientation. Religions in China should adapt to the socialist society being pursued by the government, he said. Notably, China is accused of carrying out a crackdown on Uighur Muslims in Xinjiang.

110.title: Pic of Christopher Nolan's hand-drawn plot for his film 'Inception' goes viral
110.article_body: A post showing the hand-drawn plot map of the Hollywood movie 'Inception' has gone viral on Twitter. The tweet by Julian Shapiro shows a paper depicting director Christopher Nolan's scribbling about the film's plot in detail. The plot map has been taken from the book 'The Nolan Variations: The Movies, Mysteries, and Marvels of Christopher Nolan' written by Tom Shone.

111.title: Kohli didn't make 70 hundreds in his aunt's courtyard or on Candy Crush: Shoaib Akhtar
111.article_body: Former Pakistan fast bowler Shoaib Akhtar has said that he is defending Virat Kohli over his poor form as he has scored 70 hundreds in international cricket. "Kohli didn't make 70 hundreds in his aunt's courtyard or while playing Candy Crush," he added. Akhtar further said, "All the criticism that is directed at him is designed to make him stronger."

112.title: Russia orders its forces to step up operations in Ukraine
112.article_body: Russia's Defence Ministry on Saturday said that the Russian forces have been ordered to step up operations in Ukraine. The order aims to prevent Ukraine from launching strikes on Ukrainian areas under the Russian control, it added. Notably, the order comes amid the latest series of bombardments by Russian forces across Ukraine.

113.title: Shardul could come in India's squad: Jaffer ahead of 3rd ODI vs England
113.article_body: Wasim Jaffer said all-rounder Shardul Thakur could come in India's squad for third ODI against England at Old Trafford. "When Mohammad Shami comes in at eight, that means the tail is rather lengthy. India have Ravindra Jadeja and Hardik Pandya, so he [Shardul] could be the sixth bowling option as well," he added. Third ODI will be played on Sunday.

114.title: 'Which is lower caste?' asks TN University paper, VC orders probe
114.article_body: The Vice-Chancellor of Periyar University in Tamil Nadu's Salem has ordered a probe into an exam question of a history paper asking students to identify a "lower caste". The state Higher Education Department has formed a committee under a chief officer to hold an enquiry into the matter. "Due action would be initiated...against the wrongdoers," the department said.

115.title: Who are the toppers of CA final 2022 exam?
115.article_body: The results of the ICAI CA final 2022 exam were announced on Friday and 22-year-old Meet Anil Shah from Mumbai emerged as the topper. Shah cleared the exam on his first attempt with a score of 642 out of a total of 800 marks. Akshat Goyal from Jaipur and Shrushti Sanghavi from Surat secured the second and third ranks, respectively.

116.title: Process is punishment in India's criminal justice system: CJI
116.article_body: CJI NV Ramana has stated that the process is the punishment in India's criminal justice system. He said, "From…indiscriminate arrests, to difficulty in obtaining bail, the process leading to the prolonged incarceration of undertrials needs…attention." Referring to unlawful evictions, he said, "Without state intervention in such [cases] through legal aid, violators will never be held accountable."

117.title: Dhankhar spent years in public service: Rajnath on NDA VP candidate
117.article_body: Reacting to Jagdeep Dhankhar's nomination as NDA's candidate for the Vice President of India's post, Defence Minister Rajnath Singh congratulated him and tweeted, "He has spent years in public service." "He is a farmer's son who has a deep understanding of Law and the Constitution. India will greatly benefit from his experience," Rajnath Singh tweeted.

118.title: Demi Lovato cuts face on amethyst crystal, gets three stitches
118.article_body: Singer Demi Lovato revealed that she recently cut her face on a huge amethyst crystal when she bent to pick something up, adding she needed three stitches. The injury came ahead of her appearance on talk show 'Jimmy Kimmel Live!' "I did what any sane person would do and I made a TikTok before I even told anyone," Demi said.

119.title: ITBP jawan kills self after shooting 3 colleagues at camp in J&K
119.article_body: An Indo-Tibetan Border Police (ITBP) jawan opened fire injuring three of his colleagues before killing himself at a camp in Jammu and Kashmir's Udhampur on Saturday. Constable Bhupendra Singh shot at his colleagues, leading to bullet injuries to a head constable and two constables, a senior ITBP officer said. Singh later shot himself from his service rifle, the official added.

120.title: Aditya Roy Kapur, Mrunal Thakur wrap 'Gumraah', T-Series shares pics
120.article_body: The official handle of T-Series announced a filming wrap on the upcoming film 'Gumraah' which stars Aditya Roy Kapur and Mrunal Thakur, sharing pictures from the last day. The film, which is based on true events, features Aditya in a double role and Mrunal as a police official. The crime thriller is helmed by debutant director Vardhan Ketkar.

121.title: Gold, electronic goods worth ₹1.3 cr seized at Chennai airport, 3 held
121.article_body: The customs department on Saturday said that gold and electronic goods worth ₹1.37 crore were seized in separate incidents at Chennai airport and three people were arrested. In the first incident, the authorities intercepted a passenger and recovered gold worth ₹55.38 lakh. In another incident, gold ingots, electronic goods and cigarettes worth ₹81.78 lakh were recovered from two passengers.

122.title: US also made mistakes: Saudi Crown Prince to Biden on Khashoggi's murder
122.article_body: Saudi Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman told President Joe Biden that the killing of journalist Jamal Khashoggi was "a painful episode for Saudi Arabia and that it was a terrible mistake", according to a Saudi minister. Salman said that the US has also made mistakes, citing America's involvement in the wars in Iraq and Afghanistan, the minister said.

123.title: Karnataka CM launches free COVID-19 booster dose drive
123.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai on Saturday launched free COVID-19 booster doses for people above 18 years of age as a part of the 'Amrit Mahotsav' of COVID vaccination drive. "A state could progress only when it has an educated, healthy society," Bommai said. About 7,500 vaccination centres have been opened for the campaign, Bommai added.

124.title: Novak not as popular as Nadal, Federer but he's a credit to tennis: McEnroe
124.article_body: Recalling how 21-time Grand Slam champion Novak Djokovic was booed at French Open 2022, John McEnroe said, "Djokovic, you may not like him as much as Rafael Nadal or Roger Federer, but he's a credit to our game for god's sake." He added, "He [Daniil Medvedev] didn't deserve that [being booed], nor did Djokovic deserve it at the French [Open]."

125.title: Monitoring state borders: TN Minister after Kerala reports monkeypox case
125.article_body: Tamil Nadu Health Minister Ma Subramanian on Saturday said his government is monitoring the state's borders with Kerala at 13 checkpoints. This comes after India reported the first case of monkeypox in Kerala. "We're already conducting mass fever screening camps and...have also attached monkeypox screening to it. If anyone is found with symptoms they will be monitored," Subramanian said.

126.title: Telangana Governor to visit flood-hit Bhadrachalam on July 17
126.article_body: Telangana Governor Tamilisai Soundararajan will visit the flood-hit areas of Bhadrachalam town and meet the affected people on Sunday, July 17. Meanwhile, CM K Chandrashekar Rao will conduct an aerial survey of all affected districts along the Godavari river on Sunday. The water level at Bhadrachalam dam has reportedly touched 70 feet, for the first time in over 30 years.

127.title: Complete freedom given to CID: K'taka Minister on PSI scam investigation
127.article_body: Karnataka Home Minister Araga Jnanendra on Saturday said the state government is investigating the PSI scam very seriously and added that the CID has been given complete freedom of investigation. "CID is not putting any pressure on Amrit Paul (arrested ADGP)," he said. Over 65 people have been arrested in the Karnataka PSI scam so far.

128.title: Dhankhar's experience will benefit nation: Shah on NDA's VP candidate
128.article_body: Reacting to Jagdeep Dhankhar's nomination as NDA's candidate for the Vice President of India's post, Union Home Minister Amit Shah tweeted, "His...long administrative experience in the constitutional process of the House will greatly benefit the country." "I am sure that with the election of Shri Dhankhar ji as Vice President...the dignity of our Upper House will increase further," he added.

129.title: 215 Indian athletes to take part in Commonwealth Games 2022, list released
129.article_body: The Indian Olympic Association on Saturday announced a 322-strong contingent including 215 athletes and 107 officials and support staff for the Commonwealth Games 2022. The Games are scheduled to be held in Birmingham from July 28 to August 8. Some prominent Indian athletes include include Neeraj Chopra, PV Sindhu, Mirabai Chanu, Lovlina Borgohain, Bajrang Punia and Ravi Kumar Dahiya.

130.title: European Commission sues Hungary over LGBTQ law
130.article_body: The European Commission is suing Hungary for limiting access to information on LGBTQ issues and for cancelling the licence of the country's last independent radio broadcaster. The developments at the European Court of Justice could see EU funds being frozen for Hungary. Presently, Hungary restricts information about LGBTQ from youngsters.

131.title: Fans chase MS Dhoni, take running selfies with him on London street; video goes viral
131.article_body: A video has gone viral on social media showing fans chasing MS Dhoni and taking running selfies with him on a street in London. In the video, fans can be seen keeping pace with security personnel surrounding Dhoni to get a glimpse of the former India captain. Dhoni was seen attending India's second ODI against England at Lord's.

132.title: Seoul celebrates its first pride parade in 3 years
132.article_body: Thousands of gay rights supporters marched in the Seoul Queer Parade on Saturday, which was held after a three-year gap due to the coronavirus pandemic. Participants carrying rainbow banners demanded an end to discrimination based on sexual orientation. The parade was held under police presence as nearby streets were filled with conservative Christians, protesting the "lewd" parade.

133.title: UK govt to hold emergency meet over high temperatures
133.article_body: The UK government will hold an emergency response meeting on Saturday to prepare for the record high temperatures the country is expecting in the coming days. British authorities on Friday issued their first ever "red" warning for heat conditions next week when temperatures could rise to 40°C. The highest temperature recorded in the UK was in 2019 at 38.7°C.

134.title: Tara Sutaria debuts as singer in 'Ek Villain Returns' song 'Shaamat'
134.article_body: Actress Tara Sutaria has debuted as a singer in Bollywood with the song 'Shaamat' from her upcoming film 'Ek Villain Returns' which also features Arjun Kapoor. Rapper Badshah also makes a special appearance in the music video. The song shows snippets of the love story between Tara and Arjun's characters along with Tara's character performing at concerts.

135.title: Calcutta HC asks police to trace pig stolen from district court
135.article_body: The Calcutta High Court on Friday ordered Nadia District Police to launch an investigation to trace 'Ghana', the missing pig who used to live on the premises of Kalyani Court. Four men allegedly stole Ghana on March 25, 2022. A lawyer of the district court said a police complaint had been lodged earlier, however, the police took no action.

136.title: Girl injured as rhino attacks her in Kaziranga National Park
136.article_body: A girl was injured on Saturday after a rhino attacked her in Assam's Kaziranga National Park and Tiger Reserve. The girl, identified as Priya Chowra, hails from the Hatikhuli area near the park. She is undergoing treatment at Bokakhat Hospital, a forest range officer said. The incident took place at the Haldibari corridor near the Hatikhuli area of the park.

137.title: Ban on photography, videography in K'taka govt offices withdrawn
137.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai on Saturday said the government has withdrawn the ban on photography and videography in all government offices across the state. The order was withdrawn after activists and Opposition parties criticised the move. Karnataka State Government Employees Association alleged that employees were harassed by certain people shooting videos and photos in government offices.

138.title: Senior opposition leader in Russia sentenced to 4 years in prison
138.article_body: A senior opposition leader in Russia has been sentenced to four years in prison for allegedly "directing an undesirable organisation". Andrei Pivovarov, former chief of the political group Open Russia, has denied the charges, saying they were made as he was planning to run for Parliament. Opposition leader Alexei Navalny was jailed earlier in January 2021.

139.title: Where is church priest & Imam: DMK MP at govt 'bhoomi pujan' event
139.article_body: DMK MP S Senthilkumar objected to a 'bhoomi pujan' for a government road project which was being prepared to be held only by a Hindu priest in Tamil Nadu's Dharmapuri. Pointing to the priest, he said, "Where are the other religions? Where is the Christian and the Muslim? Invite the Church father, the Imam...the atheists [and representatives of] Dravidar Kazhagam."

140.title: US will not walk away from Middle East: Biden in Saudi Arabia
140.article_body: Speaking at a summit of Arab leaders in Saudi Arabia on Saturday, US President Joe Biden said, "We'll not walk away and leave a vacuum to be filled by China, Russia or Iran." "We'll seek to build on this moment with active, principled, American leadership," he added. Notably, this was Biden's first trip to the Middle East as the President.

141.title: Only change I'm expecting in 3rd ODI is Arshdeep for Krishna: Zaheer
141.article_body: Ahead of third India-England ODI, Zaheer Khan said he doesn't expect any changes in India's playing XI. He added that, however, the only change he is expecting is inclusion of Arshdeep Singh and whether he would replace Prasidh Krishna to get that swing at Old Trafford. Match will be played on Sunday. The three-match series is currently tied at 1-1.

142.title: 'Kisan Putra', known for his humility: PM on NDA's Vice President candidate Dhankhar
142.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Saturday called West Bengal Governor and NDA's Vice President of India candidate Jagdeep Dhankhar a "Kisan Putra" (son of a farmer). "Jagdeep Dhankhar Ji is known for his humility...He has always worked for the well-being of farmers, youth, women and the marginalised," said PM. "[I'm] glad that he (Dhankhar) will be our VP candidate," he added.

143.title: Suryakumar should certainly bat at no. 4: RP Singh ahead of 3rd ODI
143.article_body: RP Singh said India batter Suryakumar Yadav should certainly bat at number four in third India-England ODI. "If a player is in form, then his position shouldn't be tinkered with at that point," he added. Batting at number four, Suryakumar scored his maiden international century(117) in third T20I against England. Suryakumar, while batting at number five, hit 27 at Lord's.

144.title: Sri Lanka rations fuel amid shortage due to economic crisis
144.article_body: Sri Lanka on Saturday introduced a fuel rationing scheme amid a shortage due to an economic crisis in the country. "A guaranteed weekly fuel quota will be allocated," Sri Lanka's Power and Energy Minister Kanchana Wijesekera tweeted. Separately, Wijesekera said that the Sri Lankan government has requested various countries to provide the country with fuel supplies amid the crisis.

145.title: Kevin Spacey dropped from Genghis Khan film amid sexual assault charges
145.article_body: Actor Kevin Spacey has been dropped from '1242: Gateway To The West' amid the charges of sexual assault against him in UK. The film is a historical drama about a holy man in a Hungarian castle that fights to stop Genghis Khan's armies from invading Europe. Spacey has denied the allegations against him and travelled to UK to face charges.

146.title: Ranbir, Kartik, Kriti named most stylish at HT India's Most Stylish 2022
146.article_body: Actor Ranbir Kapoor was named Most Stylish Superstar at HT India's Most Stylish 2022 awards. Kartik Aaryan and Kriti Sanon won the awards for India's Most Stylish male and female, respectively. Arjun Kapoor and Malaika Arora won for Most Stylish Couple. Style Legend awards were given to Anil Kapoor and Raveena Tandon. Pankaj Tripathi won the Style With Substance award.

147.title: How does the medal tally look after Day 1 of World Athletics Championships 2022?
147.article_body: Japan are on top of medal standings after Day 1 of World Athletics Championships 2022. Japan bagged a gold medal and a silver medal to top the standings after the first day. Japan are followed by Dominican Republic and Peru, who won one gold medal each. Netherlands and Poland are joint-fourth, having won a silver medal each on Day 1.

148.title: Space for opposition diminishing, not sign of healthy democracy: CJI
148.article_body: Chief Justice of India (CJI) NV Ramana on Saturday said, "Political opposition should not translate into hostility...These are not signs of a healthy democracy." "There used to be mutual respect between government and opposition. Unfortunately, space for opposition is diminishing," he added. "Sadly, the country is witnessing a decline in the quality of legislative performance," the CJI said.

149.title: Bill Gates once took 'my girls' at a Las Vegas bar, says billionaire Mark Cuban
149.article_body: Billionaire Shark Tank judge Mark Cuban jokingly recounted how a then newly wealthy Microsoft Co-founder Bill Gates 'stole' some 'girls' he was buying drinks for at a Las Vegas bar. "This was right when Microsoft went public...[The girls said], 'I've got to go to the bathroom.'...And then they don't come back...Bill Gates took my girls!" said Cuban in a podcast.

150.title: 21-yr-old Tomar wins gold in Men's 50m Rifle 3 Positions at Shooting WC
150.article_body: Indian shooter Aishwary Pratap Singh Tomar won a gold medal in Men's 50m Rifle 3 Positions at ISSF World Cup after beating Hungarian Zalan Pekler 16-12 in gold medal match on Saturday in Changwon, Korea. The 21-year-old junior world champion had topped the qualification round with a score of 593. India are currently on top of standings with four golds.

151.title: UP man held captive by Saudi employer for over 1 yr returns home
151.article_body: A 35-year-old man returned to his village in Uttar Pradesh on Friday after spending over one year in the captivity of his employer in Saudi Arabia, police said on Saturday. Rakesh Upadhyay's return was made possible due to the Indian Embassy's intervention. Upadhyay had arrived in Saudi Arabia to work as a plumber in 2019 on a two-year contract.

152.title: Jagdeep Dhankhar named as NDA candidate for post of Vice President of India
152.article_body: BJP chief JP Nadda on Saturday announced that West Bengal Governor Jagdeep Dhankhar is NDA's candidate for the post of the Vice-President of India. The announcement was made after a BJP parliamentary board meeting held in Delhi. Dhankhar is a "kisan putra" (son of a farmer) who established himself as "people's governor", Nadda said.

153.title: Power of noise cancellation: Sushmita as she shares new post after dating announcement
153.article_body: Actress Sushmita Sen took to Instagram to share a picture from Maldives. "Ah Serenity & the power of noise cancellation!!! #trulyblessed," she wrote in the picture's caption. The actress had earlier shared a post after former IPL Chairman Lalit Modi confirmed that they are dating, wherein she wrote, "I am in a happy place!!! Not married...No rings...Enough clarification given."

154.title: Too early to say if Kohli can make it to India XI for T20 WC 2022: Karim
154.article_body: Amid Virat Kohli's poor form, Saba Karim said it's too early to question the batter's place in India's playing XI for T20 World Cup, beginning October 16, as there's a lot of time before the tournament starts. "He's fighting his own battle...team management shouldn't pay heed to the criticism and believe in his process to return to...form," he added.

155.title: 51 lakh households will not have to pay for electricity in Punjab: CM
155.article_body: Around 51 lakh households in Punjab will not have to pay their electricity bills due to the scheme that provides 300 units of power for free, Chief Minister Bhagwant Mann said on Saturday. He also said that the scheme had been implemented from July 1. The scheme will cost the Punjab government ₹1,800 crore, according to the state budget.

156.title: 6 dead, 71 hospitalised after diarrhoea outbreak in Odisha's Rayagada
156.article_body: At least six people died and 71 others were hospitalised in the last three days due to diarrhoea after allegedly drinking contaminated water from open sources in several villages in Odisha's Rayagada district, officials said on Saturday. A team of 11 doctors visited the affected villages and collected water and blood samples and sent those for examination.

157.title: Many SC lawyers charge ₹10-15 lakh/hearing, how can a common man afford it?: Rijiju
157.article_body: Union Law Minister Kiren Rijiju on Saturday talked about the high fees charged by Supreme Court lawyers which he said can go up to ₹10-15 lakh per hearing. "How can a common man afford it?" asked Rijiju, adding, "The court should not be only for the privileged." He said, "I believe the doors of justice should be open to all."

158.title: Gang dealing in stolen phones busted in Mumbai, 480 mobiles seized
158.article_body: Mumbai Police on Saturday claimed to have busted a gang dealing in stolen mobiles, arresting two men and seizing around 480 phones from them, including iPhones. Besides the mobiles, a laptop, 9.5 kg marijuana, 174 foreign liquor bottles and two swords were seized in the raids at suburban Mankhurd. Total value of seized material was around ₹75 lakh.

159.title: Charges against Ahmed Patel mischievous: Jairam Ramesh
159.article_body: Congress General Secretary Jairam Ramesh has stated that the party refutes the "mischievous" charges "manufactured" against its late leader Ahmed Patel. He added, "This is...Prime Minister's...strategy to absolve himself of any responsibility for the communal carnage unleashed [in Gujarat in 2002]." Patel has been accused of being involved in a conspiracy to topple the Gujarat government in 2002.

160.title: Sukumar Garu said 'Everyone has to walk like you': Allu Arjun on 'Pushpa' walk
160.article_body: Speaking about his tilted-shoulder walk in 'Pushpa: The Rise', actor Allu Arjun said that he was told by Sukumar Garu, "I don't know what you do but everybody has to walk like you." The actor added he came up with the tilted-shoulder walk thinking it would be "easily imitable". Allu had earlier said that the walk hurt his shoulder joint.

161.title: My CA asked me to prepare will, I was like 'Am I going to die?': Ranbir
161.article_body: Actor Ranbir Kapoor has said that his CA recently asked him to prepare a will, adding, "I was like, 'Will?...Am I going to die? Why would I make a will at this age?'" The actor further said that he doesn't think about things like that. "Right now I'm only thinking about the excitement of having a child," he added.

162.title: I have no work, no money; should I suffocate myself to death: Neetu Chandra
162.article_body: Actress Neetu Chandra stated in an interview that she has no work and no money, adding that she feels unwanted in the industry. "Should I suffocate myself to death? Does a person's worth become known only after their demise?" the actress added. Neetu cited late actor Sushant Singh Rajput's example, saying that the thought of suicide has crossed her mind.

163.title: Pietersen shares pic with Kohli, says 'There's way more than just the bubble of cricket'
163.article_body: Ex-England captain Kevin Pietersen shared a picture of himself with Virat Kohli and penned a note in support of the ex-India captain. "Buddy...your career has had some of the best that have played...only wish they could've done what you've (so far). Be proud...walk tall & enjoy life. There's way more than just the bubble of cricket...You'll be back," he wrote.

164.title: Virat Kohli responds to Babar Azam's 'Stay strong' tweet, says 'Keep shining'
164.article_body: Former Team India captain Virat Kohli has responded to Pakistan captain Babar Azam's 'This too shall pass, stay strong' tweet. Kohli wrote, "Thank you. Keep shining and rising. Wish you all the best." Reacting to it, a fan tweeted, "This is called sportsman spirit." Another Twitter user wrote, "Love these gestures."

165.title: Defending long jump champion Gayle crashes out of World Athletics C'ships
165.article_body: Defending champion Tajay Gayle of Jamaica failed to qualify for the long jump final at World Athletics Championships after committing three fouls in qualification in Eugene, Oregon. The 25-year-old from Jamaica was unable to record a legal jump at Hayward Field on Friday. Gayle has not jumped past 8 metres this year and reportedly suffered a bone bruise weeks earlier.

166.title: Gang of thieves burgles 12 houses in 2 days in Pune
166.article_body: A gang of thieves burgled 12 houses in Pune's Parmar Co-operative Housing Society and Shraddha Regency Building between July 13 and 14, police officials said. Sub-inspector Ajay Bhosale said the house locks were broken using iron rods. A man named Shailesh Bafna filed an FIR with the police regarding all the burglaries.

167.title: 26-yr-old man run over by bus after his bike hits pothole in Thane
167.article_body: A 26-year-old man died on Saturday after his motorbike hit a pothole and he fell in front of a moving public bus in Dombivali-Kalyan, in the Thane district near Mumbai. "Ankit Thaiva was on his way to work in Ghansoli in Navi Mumbai when the incident took place on Katai-Badlapur road near Khoni village," a police official said.

168.title: Iran showcased attack-capable drones to Russian officials: US
168.article_body: Iran had showcased its "attack-capable" drones to Russian officials at Kashan Airfield on June 8 and July 15, US National Security Advisor Jake Sullivan said on Saturday. The US earlier this week said it has information that shows Iran is preparing to provide Russia with hundreds of drones for use in Ukraine. Notably, Iran's Foreign Minister had denied US' claim.

169.title: Kartik Aaryan shares 'Shehzada' first look, announces new release date
169.article_body: Actor Kartik Aaryan shared his first look from the upcoming film 'Shehzada' on social media on Saturday, writing, "#Shehzada Returns Home." The actor also announced that the film, which was scheduled for a November 4 release, will now be released on February 10, 2023. The film is directed by Rohit Dhawan and also features Kriti Sanon and Paresh Rawal.

170.title: 36-yr-old man shot in the face by minor boy in Delhi, incident caught on camera
170.article_body: A 36-year-old man suffered grievous injury in his eye after he was allegedly shot in the face by a minor boy in Delhi's Jahangirpuri area on Friday evening, police said. They have apprehended four minors in the case. "Accused said the man had beaten up the father of one of the minors 7 months back...They [came]...to take revenge," police stated.

171.title: BJP MP's convoy attacked in Telangana, he blames TRS workers
171.article_body: BJP MP Arvind Dharmapuri on Friday alleged that "10-15 goons of TRS (Telangana Rashtra Samithi)" attacked his convoy while he was visiting a village in Telangana. Dharmapuri claimed the assailants were sent by an MLA who didn't want the villagers to highlight the issue of a land scam. Police haven't confirmed if the assailants were TRS members, a report said.

172.title: It's a Test, not a T20I: Akmal on Pak's team selection for 1st Test vs SL
172.article_body: Veteran Pakistan wicketkeeper-batter Kamran Akmal has questioned Pakistan's team selection for the first Test against Sri Lanka, saying it's pretty shocking why Fawad Alam and Faheem Ashraf both have been dropped. "It's a Test match not a T20I game...too many all-rounders playing and what I think is, a Test match game is all about specialists," he tweeted.

173.title: Sonia Gandhi behind plot to frame Narendra Modi in Guj riots: BJP
173.article_body: The BJP on Saturday alleged Congress President Sonia Gandhi was the "driving force" behind the "conspiracy" to implicate then Gujarat CM Narendra Modi in the 2002 riots case in the state. Party spokesperson Sambit Patra said, "Through her (Sonia) Chief Political Advisor, late Ahmed Patel, Sonia Gandhi attempted to malign Gujarat's image. Through him, she attempted to insult Narendra Modi."

174.title: Crying fan refuses to leave Shehnaaz Gill at event, video goes viral
174.article_body: A video is going viral on social media which shows a fan hugging actress Shehnaaz Gill at an event and refusing to let her go even as the actress' bodyguards try to separate them. The fan was also crying and kissed Shehnaaz on the cheek. Shehnaaz gave the fan a hug and left only after the fan had gained composure.

175.title: Will work on mistakes from hockey WC, start afresh for CWG: Lalremsiami
