175.article_body: Indian women's hockey team forward Lalremsiami said her side will work on the mistakes from the disappointing women's hockey World Cup campaign and start afresh for Commonwealth Games 2022. India finished ninth in the World Cup standings. India will play against Ghana in their first match of Pool A in the Commonwealth Games on July 29.

176.title: Rare 1-in-30 million orange lobster found at US restaurant, pic surfaces
176.article_body: A rare one-in-30 million orange-coloured lobster was found by a restaurant in US' Florida and handed over to an aquarium. A video of 'Cheddar' the lobster being taken from a tank at the Red Lobster restaurant has been shared by the aquarium on Twitter. The restaurant's manager helped rescue the unique shellfish.

177.title: 1st image of damage to world's most powerful telescope from space rock released
177.article_body: A picture of damage to world's most powerful telescope, James Webb Telescope, after being hit by a space rock has been released. The image shows damage to one hexagonal segment of the observatory's main mirror called C3. The micrometeorite strike raised the wavefront error of the segment from 56 nanometres to 178 nanometres after correction by adjusting the segment.

178.title: Video of little girl touching a jawan's feet goes viral
178.article_body: A clip of a little girl touching a jawan's feet at a metro station has gone viral. It was shared by politician PC Mohan on Twitter. "Raising patriotic young minds is a duty every parent owes to this great nation. Jai Hind," he wrote. "This is what we should teach our next generation," a Twitter user commented.

179.title: 2 Pune brothers assault tempo driver after road mishap, FIR filed
179.article_body: Two brothers assaulted a tempo driver after a road mishap between them in Pune. According to the FIR filed on Thursday, Ramesh Pawar's tempo hit the motorbike of Sanket Shedge and his brother. Even though Pawar offered to help with medical treatment, the brothers called their relatives and assaulted Pawar, leaving him unconscious in a pool of rainwater.

180.title: Police bust Noida-based gang who cheated foreigners of ₹170 crore
180.article_body: UP Police’s Special Task Force (STF) on Friday busted a Noida-based gang of cyber criminals who duped foreigners of ₹170 crore in the name of providing tech support and tax refunds, officials said. The gang used sophisticated softwares to target people residing in various countries, including the US, Canada, the UK and Lebanon, a senior official said.

181.title: 200 kg marijuana seized near Kerala's Thiruvananthapuram, 1 arrested
181.article_body:
The Narcotic Cell of Kerala Police on Saturday arrested a 39-year old man, identified as Kishore, and seized over 200 kg of marijuana from his residence near Thiruvananthapuram. "The raid was following a tip-off received by the Thiruvananthapuram rural SP," a senior police official said.
Police are investigating the source from where he procured the contraband.

182.title: Hyderabad to get 2.5-km long cable-stayed bridge at Mir Alam Tank
182.article_body: The Hyderabad Metropolitan Development Authority (HMDA) has proposed a cable-stayed bridge to be built across Mir Alam Tank in order to ease traffic and enhance the city's infrastructure. According to officials, the bridge will be 2.5-km long with a central span of 350 metres and will have six lanes. This bridge will be the second of its kind in Hyderabad.

183.title: 2 arrested for smuggling 66 kg dry marijuana leaves into Hyderabad
183.article_body: Two persons trying to smuggle 66 kg of dry marijuana leaves into Hyderabad were caught by the police at New Malakpet market on Saturday, police said. The accused, Muvvala Nagarjuna and Nammi Tataji, were taken into custody and three bags containing 30 packets of dry marijuana leaves, wrapped with brown packing tape were recovered, police added.

184.title: 6 people die after dust storm causes 21-vehicle pile-up in US
184.article_body: At least six people have died after a dust storm fueled by wind gusts topping 60 miles per hour caused a pile-up of 21 vehicles in US' Montana on Friday, authorities said. The accident was likely caused due to drivers being left with "zero visibility" after the storm. Montana's Governor Greg Gianforte said he's "deeply saddened by...the mass casualty crash".

185.title: His name still has weight: Daughter of late Congress leader Patel on conspiracy charges
185.article_body: Reacting to accusations of conspiracy over the 2002 Gujarat riots against her late father and Congress leader Ahmed Patel, Mumtaz Patel said, "I guess his name...still holds weight to be used for political conspiracies (and) to malign the opposition." Patel has been accused of giving money to arrested activist Teesta Setalvad to frame the then-CM Narendra Modi in riots.

186.title: All I said was don't kill each other: Sai Pallavi on her Kashmir Files remark
186.article_body: Actress Sai Pallavi has spoken about her remark on the film 'The Kashmir Files', saying it was misinterpreted by those who don't speak Telugu. "How can you take offence [at] me just saying, 'Please don't kill each other'?" she added. The actress further said, "You can take a bit of the video (interview) and make it into something else."

187.title: Over 38,100 Russian soldiers killed in war so far, says Ukraine
187.article_body: Ukraine on Saturday claimed that it has killed about 38,140 Russian soldiers since Moscow's invasion began on February 24. Ukrainian forces have destroyed 1,677 Russian tanks and over 400 aircraft, including 188 helicopters, Ukraine's Foreign Ministry said. Ukraine also claimed to have destroyed 3,874 armoured personnel carriers, 846 artillery systems and 247 Multiple Launch Rocket Systems (MLRS).

188.title: No update on why Washington is missing from India's T20I squad: Chopra
188.article_body: Former India cricketer Aakash Chopra has questioned the absence of all-rounder Washington Sundar from India's T20I squad for the upcoming series against the West Indies. "There is no trace of Sundar. There is no update...if he is fit or injured because he was going far ahead...he bowls well, can bat as well [and] fielding is okay-okay," Chopra said.

189.title: 26-year-old WB man arrested for operating sex racket in Thane
189.article_body: A 26-year-old man, Bilal Kokan Moral, was arrested for allegedly operating a sex racket in Thane, an official said. The anti-human trafficking cell of crime branch arrested the accused, a native of West Bengal, while he was allegedly catering to a decoy customer, a senior inspector said. The accused operated in Thane, Mumbai, Pune, Chennai, Gujarat and Ghaziabad, he added.

190.title: Democracy stands ruined in the country: Oppn Prez candidate Sinha
190.article_body: Opposition candidate for Presidential polls Yashwant Sinha said when he started his campaign for the polls, he had said that democracy is in danger. "Now...I can say that...democracy stands ruined in the country," Sinha said at a press conference in Ranchi. He further said that Presidential elections shouldn't be made a question of identity, but a fight for ideology.

191.title: Telangana govt sanctions ₹17 crore to clear pending dues of state Waqf Board
191.article_body: The Telangana government sanctioned ₹17 crore to the state Waqf Board in order to clear the pending salaries of Imams and Muezzins in the state. "I thank Telangana CM for sanctioning ₹17 crores for the salaries of Imams and Muezzins pending from last three months," Mohammed Masiullah Khan, Chairman of the Telangana State Waqf Board, said.

192.title: Mumbai man cheated of ₹30,000 by a woman he met on dating app
192.article_body: A 33-year-old Mumbai-based man filed a complaint with the police claiming that a woman he met on a dating app extorted ₹30,000 from him. Police said that the woman indulged in obscene activity through video calls with the complainant. When he indulged in similar acts, the woman took screenshots, threatened to make them public and demanded money, police added.

193.title: 16-month-old child falls into vessel of boiling water, dies in Maha
193.article_body: A 16-month-old child who fell into a large vessel containing boiling water has succumbed to burn injuries in Maharashtra's Aurangabad, a police official said on Saturday. The incident occurred while a feast was being prepared in the household for a wedding ceremony. Undetected by the family, the toddler apparently managed to reach the vessel and then fell into it.

194.title: Mahatma Gandhi statue vandalised, face stolen in Punjab's Bathinda
194.article_body: A statue of Mahatma Gandhi was vandalised at a public park in Punjab's Bathinda on the intervening night of Thursday and Friday, said police. The vandals, who took away the statue's face, are yet to be identified. The police said that the CCTV footage of the area was being analysed and that the perpetrators will be caught soon.

195.title: Why was Ashwin totally sidelined after the last T20 WC: Chopra
195.article_body: After spinner Ravichandran Ashwin was named in India's T20I squad for the West Indies series, former India cricketer Aakash Chopra questioned why the 35-year-old bowler was "totally sidelined" after the T20 World Cup 2021. "Why was Ashwin not there...for the last 8-10 months?" Chopra questioned. He added that Ashwin should have played in this month's T20I series against England.

196.title: Form 75 smaller states, make announcement on 15th August: Cong leader to PM
196.article_body: Congress leader Ashish Deshmukh has requested Prime Minister Narendra Modi to form 75 smaller states as a gift to India on its 75th anniversary of independence. "It is a humble request that the concept of 75@75 should be started with the formation of the 30th state of 'Vidarbha' and you should make an announcement...on this 15th August," he added

197.title: MCD suspends 2 engineers over wall collapse in Delhi's Alipur
197.article_body: The Municipal Corporation of Delhi (MCD) has suspended a junior engineer and an assistant engineer over the wall collapse incident in Delhi's Alipur. The MCD has also ordered a probe into the incident that killed five people. Earlier, the police had registered a case and arrested two people in connection with the incident.

198.title: Felt I need to do my job, not show Ranbir, I were childhood friends: Arjun
198.article_body: Television actor Arjun Bijlani said that his reunion with actor Ranbir Kapoor was really special. He said, "I felt at that time he's coming on the show to promote his film and though I am his childhood friend, we don't need to show that. I felt there was no need to show off those things," he added.

199.title: No release in 5 yrs but SRK's 1 move creates storm everywhere: Taapsee
199.article_body: Talking about actor Shah Rukh Khan who will be her co-star in the film 'Dunki', actress Taapsee Pannu said, "[He hasn't released a film in the last five years] but one move of his just creates a storm everywhere." "His victories are personal, his loss is personal, that's stardom," added Taapsee. "He is the superstar," she stated.

200.title: Modi & Yogi will take development to cities as well as villages: PM Modi
200.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Saturday said the Bundelkhand Expressway in Uttar Pradesh will bring an industrial boom in the region. "It is the Modi and Yogi government, we will take development not just to cities but to villages," he said. The 296-km-long expressway extends from NH-35 at Gonda village in Chitrakoot to near Kudrail village in Etawah district.

201.title: Hardik Pandya was in shock when MI didn't retain him: Ravi Shastri
201.article_body: Ex-India head coach Ravi Shastri revealed that all-rounder Hardik Pandya was in shock when Mumbai Indians (MI) didn't retain him ahead of IPL 2022. "It was tough...MI had Ishan Kishan, Rohit Sharma, Jasprit Bumrah, Suryakumar Yadav and Hardik...so they had to pick three out of those five," Shastri said. Hardik was picked by Gujarat Titans (GT) and was named captain.

202.title: Don't think Virat Kohli is going to respond to Babar Azam's tweet: Shahid Afridi
202.article_body: Talking about Babar Azam tweeting in support of Virat Kohli, former Pakistan captain Shahid Afridi said, "Babar has given across an incredible message." He added, "I think Virat should have responded by now. It would be a very big thing if there is a response to Babar's tweet, but I don't think that is going to happen."

203.title: Johar's 'Rocky Aur Rani...' postponed due to Alia's pregnancy: Reports
203.article_body: Filmmaker Karan Johar's 'Rocky Aur Rani Ki Prem Kahani' featuring Alia Bhatt and Ranveer Singh will not release on February 10, as previously announced, due to Alia's pregnancy, according to reports. "Keeping Alia's pregnancy in mind, Karan has delayed the shooting schedule of a film's key sequence...The delay in the shooting has...led to a delay in...release," a source told Pinkvilla.

204.title: Was compared to mom, I'm immune: Janhvi on comparison with Nayanthara
204.article_body: Janhvi Kapoor, who'll next be seen in 'Good Luck Jerry', a remake of Nayanthara-starrer 'Kolamavu Kokila', has responded to comparisons being drawn between her and Nayanthara. "The pressure of comparisons...has hounded me from...start," she said, adding, "I was...compared to my mom, who was, I think, the greatest actor of all time. So, I'm immune to...comparison thing a little bit."

205.title: Umran shouldn't be dropped from team; take him forward slowly: Chopra
205.article_body: Former cricketer Aakash Chopra questioned the decision to drop pacer Umran Malik from the Indian squad for the upcoming West Indies T20I series. "At one point, you made Umran part of all teams...now he is part of none...If you feel he isn't ready, then take him forward slowly, but don't drop him from the team," Chopra said.

206.title: If inflation calms down, Tesla can lower car prices: Musk
206.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk on Friday said that the electric car maker could lower prices for cars if inflation comes down. Responding to a user who asked him if Tesla had any plans to lower prices that it had raised amid the pandemic and supply chain woes, Musk replied, "If inflation calms down, we can lower prices for cars."

207.title: Ensure peaceful transfer of power: UN to Sri Lankan politicians
207.article_body: The UN has urged all senior politicians in Sri Lanka to ensure a peaceful transfer of power in line with the Constitution. Sri Lankan President Gotabaya Rajapaksa resigned on Thursday after fleeing the country amid protests. "It's important that the root causes of the current instability and...people's grievances are addressed," UN Resident Coordinator in Sri Lanka, Hanaa Singer-Hamdy, said.

208.title: Patna coaching centre bombed over free tuition demand by gangster; video surfaces
208.article_body: A coaching institute in Bihar's Patna was allegedly attacked with bomb by miscreants, who demanded free admission to their candidates and a ₹5 lakh-ransom. Some staff of the institute sustained injuries, but no casualties were reported in the attack. Patna SSP said local gangster Raja Yadav was identified as one of the accused and raids are underway to arrest him.

209.title: PV Sindhu beats Saena Kawakami; advances to finals of Singapore Open
209.article_body: Indian badminton player PV Sindhu defeated Japan's Saena Kawakami by 21-15 and 21-7 in the semi-final match of the women's singles event at the Singapore Open 2022 on Saturday. The 27-year-old shuttler has now advanced to the finals, where she will meet China's Wang Zhi Yi. Notably, Sindhu is yet to win her maiden Super 500 title of this season.

210.title: Shinde-led new Maha govt renames Aurangabad as Sambhaji Nagar again
210.article_body: Days after former Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray renamed Aurangabad as Sambhaji Nagar and Osmanabad as Dharashiv, the new government led by CM Eknath Shinde repeated the act. Shinde said the MVA government's decision was illegal as it was taken after the alliance had lost majority in the state. "Holding a cabinet meeting [in such a situation] was illegal," said Shinde.

211.title: They can point fingers: Rhea pens note after Sushant's sister's remarks
211.article_body: After late actor Sushant Singh Rajput's sister Priyanka accused Rhea Chakraborty of ruining his life, she penned a note on Instagram Stories. Rhea wrote, "Rise above the noise. Rise above the ego. Rise so above that they only point fingers at you. Because you are where they could never be...You are enough. You are complete...Don't let them tell you otherwise."

212.title: Sangrur MP must apologise for calling Bhagat Singh 'terrorist': Hayer
212.article_body: Punjab minister Gurmeet Singh Meet Hayer has stated that Sangrur MP and Shiromani Akali Dal (Amritsar) leader Simranjit Singh Mann should apologise for calling freedom fighter Bhagat Singh a "terrorist". This comes after MP Mann said, "Bhagat Singh had killed a young English officer...He had hurled a bomb into the National Assembly...Now...tell me whether [he] was a terrorist or not."

213.title: Stood in line for fuel for 2 days, got 2-3 days' worth for LKR 10,000: SL cricketer
213.article_body: Sri Lankan cricketer Chamika Karunaratne, talking about the crisis in his country said he missed practice amid club season as he had to stand in queue for two days to get fuel. "I got it filled for LKR (Sri Lankan Rupees) 10,000 (around ₹2,200) which will last two-three days," said Karunaratne. Sri Lanka is facing a severe fuel shortage.

214.title: Regional, local languages should be promoted in lower, high courts: Rijiju
214.article_body: Union Law Minister Kiren Rijiju on Saturday said regional and local languages should be promoted in proceedings at lower and high courts across the country. The minister further added that mother tongue should not be considered any less than English. He was speaking at the inaugural session of the 18th All India Legal Services Authority in Jaipur.

215.title: Acid attack accused held after encounter with police in Noida
215.article_body: A man, an acid attack case accused, was arrested after an encounter with police in Noida. The accused had allegedly thrown the acidic substance at a woman, apparently his former lover, on Thursday night near a hotel in the Mamura area and fled the spot, police said. The woman suffered burn injuries and was taken to a hospital.

216.title: Were many days when I'd given up, would speak to Alia: Ranbir on Shamshera
216.article_body: Talking about his film 'Shamshera', actor Ranbir Kapoor said, "It was extremely hard. There were many days when I had given up." "I talked to myself, tried to have a therapy session with myself. I used to go home and speak to Alia Bhatt about it. [I would tell her] 'I am empty. I don't know what's happening'," added Ranbir.

217.title: Was tough pretending to be Dhanush's enemy as I really like him: Gosling
217.article_body: Ryan Gosling in an interview praised 'The Gray Man' co-star Dhanush, saying that he's incredible, funny and charming. Calling him a "great actor", Gosling said he was so precise that he never made a mistake. "The biggest difficulty was pretending to be enemies because I...liked him so much," said Gosling. Dhanush plays an assassin named Avik San in the film.

218.title: Hoping for a podium finish: Thirushkamini on India Women ahead of CWG 2022
218.article_body: Cricketer MD Thirushkamini, who has played 39 ODIs for India Women, said she's hoping that India Women have a podium finish at upcoming Commonwealth Games 2022. "Women's cricket in the country will definitely stand to benefit if we finish on the podium," she added. She further said that she hopes Indian women's cricket makes a "thumping debut" in Birmingham.

219.title: Johnny Depp writes foreword to children's book written by fan
219.article_body: Actor Johnny Depp has written the foreword to children's book 'Thumper's London Adventure' written by his fan cancer survivor Katie Vanrdrilla. Johnny first met Katie in 2011 when she was diagnosed with leukemia and wished to meet the actor through the Make-A-Wish Foundation. Johnny wrote, "For my dearest Katie, for her dear family and friends...Please know that you are loved."

220.title: Secure enough to know we can co-exist: Janhvi on equation with Sara, Ananya
220.article_body: Actress Janhvi Kapoor opened up on her equation with Sara Ali Khan and Ananya Panday and said she's "really fond of these girls". She added that she has a lot of respect for what they do and wants them to do really well. "I think they'd want the same for me...We're secure enough to know that we can...co-exist," said Janhvi.

221.title: 1,000+ dark spots in Delhi to be lit for women's safety, ₹11 cr allocated
221.article_body: More than 1,000 dark spots in Delhi will be lit up by the civic agencies to strengthen women's safety in the city. Reports said that the Centre has allocated ₹11 crore for the project. "Such spots in the South, West and North Delhi will soon be illuminated with new LED lights," officials said.

222.title: Sula Vineyards to go public, files IPO papers with SEBI
222.article_body: Nashik-based Sula Vineyards has filed draft papers with the Securities and Exchange Board of India to raise capital through an IPO. The IPO will be entirely an offer for sale (OFS) with up to 25,546,186 equity shares put up for sale. The company has not finalised the date or price of the IPO as yet.

223.title: Request Yashwant to withdraw from Presidential race: Ex-MP Prakash Ambedkar
223.article_body: Vanchit Bahujan Aaghadi National President and former MP Prakash Ambedkar has requested Opposition's Presidential candidate Yashwant Sinha to withdraw from the race. He said that Sinha should do so as many Scheduled Caste and Scheduled Tribe members from across parties are joining to vote for NDA's candidate Droupadi Murmu. Murmu will become the first tribal President of India if elected.

224.title: 59-yr-old man arrested in Mumbai for not returning Brazilian student's bag
224.article_body: An autorickshaw driver was arrested for allegedly not returning a Brazilian student's bag after the latter forgot it inside the vehicle in Mumbai's Goregaon East area. Later, the student, Marina Leao (23), registered an FIR at the Dindoshi Police Station against the accused, Kanhaiyalal Pal (59). The bag, which had Leao's passport and iPad, was returned to her, police said.

225.title: Unfit Biden won't finish his term: Former White House Physician
225.article_body: Claiming that US President Joe Biden is struggling with cognitive issues, former White House Physician Ronny Jackson said that Biden won't be able to finish his four-year term in office. "Everyone knows he's unfit for the job. His mind is too far gone," Jackson added. Biden, who is 79, is the oldest person to serve as the US President.

226.title: People want refreshing ideas, not stale formula films: Kangana on Emergency
226.article_body: Discussing her film 'Emergency' where she'll portray late Prime Minister Indira Gandhi, actress Kangana Ranaut said, "The audience is looking for something which will stimulate their intellectual side and not just their sensual side." "This is what people are starved for...People...want to see...refreshing ideas and not...stale typical formula films," she added. Kangana will also direct the film.

227.title: My belongings were stolen when I was a student: Mahindra on Mumbai Police's post
227.article_body: Mumbai Police shared a post stating that officers helped a Brazilian student by catching an auto-rickshaw driver who stole her iPad, visa, passport and ₹15,000 cash. Replying to the tweet, Anand Mahindra said, "I can just imagine the relief for this young woman. I've had my belongings stolen while traveling overseas as a student and it's a harrowing experience."

228.title: 'Jumlajeevi' unparliamentary as 'Mahamanush' upset: Congress leader
228.article_body: Rajasthan Congress chief Govind Singh Dotasra tweeted, "Jumlas were given in the name of jobs. It was nothing wrong then and now you are feeling 'jumlajeevi' is unparliamentary." "Say straightforward..the mood of 'Mahamanush' is upset with the opposition raising public issues in Parliament," he added. This comes after list of words not allowed in the Parliament was released.

229.title: 14 sheep die, several critical after eating poisonous plants in Pune
229.article_body: As many as 14 sheep died and several others are in a critical condition after allegedly grazing on poisonous plants in Indapur tehsil of Pune district, officials said. Preliminary investigation showed that the sheep might have consumed the Lantana camara plant, which is a type of weed, the District Deputy Commissioner of the Animal Husbandry Department said.

230.title: K'taka HC summons BBMP engineers over lake encroachments in Bengaluru
230.article_body: The Karnataka High Court has asked executive engineers of Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) to appear before it on July 20 over encroachment of lakes in Bengaluru. The court ordered summons while hearing a petition regarding encroachment in Subramanyapura, Begur and Puttenahalli lakes. The court observed that writing letters to departments wasn't enough to remove encroachments.

231.title: Pics show Antarctica's sky turning purple after volcanic eruption
231.article_body: Months after the Tongan volcanic eruption, the Antarctic sky has turned shades of purple due to the afterglow from the eruption. The Hunga Tonga-Hunga Ha'apai volcano erupted in January, triggering a tsunami. Following the eruption, aerosols made of sulphate particles, sea salt and water vapour circulated in the air, bending and scattering sunlight and creating a glow in the sky.

232.title: Rare animal spotted in the Pacific Ocean for the first time ever, pic surfaces
232.article_body: A rare animal was spotted in the Pacific Ocean for the first time ever. The Solumbellula sea pen, a colonial cnidarian, was spotted by scientists at 2,994 metres on a never-before-surveyed seamount north of Johnston Atoll. The Solumbellula sea pen had a single large feeding polyp with pinnate tentacles stretching over 40 cm from its 2-metre-long stalk.

233.title: Drunk assailants attack people on Pune roads, bite policeman
233.article_body: A group of suspected drunk persons, including a 17-year-old boy, attacked people for no reason on Pune's Kelkar Road and Tilak Road on Friday. One of them also bit a policeman when he tried to stop them. "They were carrying a sharp weapon while moving in the autorickshaw," police said. A video of the incident went viral on social media.

234.title: Making a comeback at 35-plus was never going to be easy: 37-yr-old Karthik
234.article_body: India wicketkeeper-batter Dinesh Karthik, who recently returned to India squad after almost three years in T20I series against South Africa, said making a comeback at 35-plus was never going to be easy. "I quietly believed in myself and did the hard yards before the IPL," he added. The 37-year-old scored his maiden T20I fifty in Rajkot last month.

235.title: 31-yr-old Kerala man stabbed to death on Bengaluru outskirts, probe on
235.article_body: A 31-year-old man from Kerala was stabbed to death on the outskirts of Bengaluru on Thursday night. The deceased, identified as Sanu Thomson, worked at a factory in Jigani. According to police, Thomson was returning to his paying guest accommodation on Thursday when three men on a bike stabbed him with a knife and fled from the spot.

236.title: 'Revari' culture dangerous for country's development: PM Modi in UP
236.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi, after inaugurating the Bundelkhand Expressway in Uttar Pradesh on Saturday, cautioned people against "revari (sweet) culture" and said, "It could be very dangerous for the development of the country." "Those with revari culture will never build new expressways, new airports or defence corridors for you. Together we have to defeat this thinking," the PM added.

237.title: Blood of Saudi Crown Prince's next victim is on your hands: Khashoggi's fiancee to Biden
237.article_body: After US President Joe Biden met Saudi Arabia's Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman and fist-bumped with the leader, Jamal Khashoggi's fiancee Hatice Cengiz said, "The blood of MBS' next victim is on your hands." Biden said he holds MBS responsible for Khashoggi's death, adding, "I'm sorry she (Cengiz) feels that way. I was straightforward back then. I was straightforward today."

238.title: Performed in farewell party wearing jacket from Chor Bazaar: Rajkummar
238.article_body: Actor Rajkummar Rao said he performed at his school's farewell party wearing a jacket worth ₹100 and a chain costing ₹15 which he purchased from Delhi's Chor Bazaar, as he was battling financial struggle. Discussing the period when he moved to Mumbai, Rajkummar had said, "There were times when I lived on one Parle-G packet a day with...₹18 in my...account."

239.title: Lawyer fined ₹50,000 for accusing Jain of owning benami property: AAP
239.article_body: AAP MLA Saurabh Bharadwaj on Friday said that Delhi Lokayukta has imposed a fine of ₹50,000 on advocate Neeraj for falsely accusing minister Satyendar Jain of owning benami property. Neeraj has not produced any evidence against the AAP leader in court, Bharadwaj added. He further accused BJP of misusing powers of agencies like ED and CBI to malign AAP leaders.

240.title: West too focused on Ukraine to devote much time to SL: Ex-Indian envoy
240.article_body: India's ex-Ambassador to Sri Lanka, Ashok Kantha, said that the "western world is too caught up with Ukraine to devote much time and resources" to the ongoing economic crisis in Sri Lanka. "Other than India, which has pledged close to $4 billion as economic assistance to Sri Lanka, western agencies like...World Bank and...IMF have done very little," Kantha told Moneycontrol.

241.title: India is the only country that's given us credit line: SL Minister amid crisis
241.article_body: Sri Lankan Power and Energy Minister Kanchana Wijesekera on Saturday said that India is the "only country" that has provided Sri Lanka with a credit line amid a severe economic crisis there. India has committed $3.8 billion to support Sri Lanka. Wijesekera said Sri Lanka is also in discussions with the Russian government for support.

242.title: It doesn't bother me if somebody bitches about me: Ranbir on being called a casanova
242.article_body: In a recent conversation with Bollywood Bubble, Ranbir Kapoor opened up about the "casanova" and "cheater" image he has. "People have heard somebody's perspective...and they haven't heard mine," he said. "My focus, my hard work, my energies are only towards making a good film and it really doesn't bother me if somebody bitches about me," Ranbir added.

243.title: 80 B.Ed students expelled for carrying phones in exam centre in Bihar
243.article_body: As many as 80 B.Ed students have been expelled for carrying mobile phones and guess papers in the exam centre in Bihar's Bhojpur district, an official said. "We received an input about cheating on a large scale taking place at HD Jain College...we constituted a team of male and female duty magistrates to conduct raids," Bhojpur DC said.

244.title: IT Ministry says content removal on Twitter proportional to Indian user base: Report
244.article_body: The Ministry of Electronics and Information Technology in an official review reportedly stated that the Centre's content removal orders to Twitter are "proportional" to the expanding Indian user base. The ministry said, "India is 7% of Twitter's global user base and so is the volume of removal requests." Earlier, Twitter challenged the Centre's 39 blocking orders, saying that they're arbitrary.

245.title: Garfield in talks to star as billionaire Richard Branson in a limited series
245.article_body: 'The Amazing Spider-Man' actor Andrew Garfield is in talks to portray billionaire Richard Branson in a limited series called 'Hot Air', as per Variety. It'll be directed by David Leitch, who has helmed movies like 'Deadpool 2' and 'Fast & Furious: Hobbs & Shaw'. The six-part series is based on book 'Dirty Tricks: British Airways' Secret War Against Virgin Atlantic'.

246.title: Israel strikes Gaza after rocket attack amid Biden's visit to region
246.article_body: Israeli jets struck Gaza Strip following rocket launches from the Palestinian territory on Saturday. The incident comes hours after US President Joe Biden flew from Israel to Saudi Arabia during a trip to the Middle East. The Israeli military said it had hit two facilities belonging to Hamas, the group that governs Gaza Strip.

247.title: I would hide when people watched 'Yeh Jawaani Hai Deewani': Maker Ayan
247.article_body: Filmmaker Ayan Mukerji, who directed Ranbir Kapoor and Deepika Padukone-starrer 'Yeh Jawaani Hai Deewani', said, "I used to hide when people...[watched the film]...'Oh my God what would they say', 'I hope they like the film' etc." "As a filmmaker you...feel very vulnerable and naked when you put out your film," added Ayan. "I am very nervous [about 'Brahmastra']," he stated.

248.title: Chiranjeevi hugs teary-eyed Aamir, says 'Laal Singh Chaddha' is a 'gem'
248.article_body: Veteran actor Chiranjeevi Konidela has shared a video from the special screening of 'Laal Singh Chaddha', which was organised by Aamir Khan at the former's residence in Hyderabad. In the video, Chiranjeevi could be seen hugging Aamir who was in tears after the screening. "What a gem of a film you have made!! Such a wonderful emotional journey," Chiranjeevi wrote.

249.title: Maharashtra cabinet clears proposal to name Navi Mumbai airport after DB Patil
249.article_body: The Maharashtra cabinet has cleared a proposal to name the upcoming Navi Mumbai International Airport after the late farm leader DB Patil. The decision comes weeks after protestors marched in Belapur demanding to name the under-construction airport after Patil. Notably, an earlier proposal to name the airport after Shiv Sena founder Bal Thackeray had sparked protests across a few districts.

250.title: Chahal is up there with the best, adapted game in couple of years: Hogg
250.article_body: Former Australia spinner Brad Hogg has said that India's Yuzvendra Chahal is right "up there with the best". "Chahal has adapted his game in the past couple of years. He had a period there where he got found out, but then he found a method to rebuild himself," Hogg said. "Chahal has grown as an individual as well," he added.

251.title: Served motherland to the best of my ability: Sri Lanka ex-Prez in resignation e-mail
251.article_body: Sri Lanka's former President Gotabaya Rajapaksa who resigned amid a raging economic crisis e-mailed his resignation letter to the Parliament Speaker after fleeing to Singapore. The letter, read in the Parliament on Saturday, said, "I served my motherland to the best of my ability and I'll continue to do so in future." He blamed COVID-19 for Sri Lanka's economic troubles.

252.title: Virat Kohli shares his pic with 'What if I fall...' quote amid criticism over form
252.article_body: Virat Kohli took to social media to share a picture of himself with an artwork of a quote that read 'What if I fall...Oh but my darling, what if you fly'. "Perspective," Kohli wrote in the caption. This comes amid Kohli facing criticism over his poor form. "People can only dream about what you’ve done in cricket," Kevin Pietersen commented.

253.title: Cyberabad police shares video, says 'Dangerous to travel on top of vehicle'
253.article_body: Cyberabad Traffic Police on Saturday shared a video of an accident and said that it's "dangerous" to travel while sitting on top of vehicles. The video is of an accident in which a 13-year-old boy, who was travelling while sitting on top of a vehicle, died after getting hit by the front part of a crane, the traffic police added.

254.title: B'luru-Mangaluru traffic disrupted after vehicle ban in Shiradi Ghat
254.article_body: Officials in Karnataka's Hassan have issued orders prohibiting the movement of vehicles on the Shiradi Ghat stretch of NH-75 connecting Bengaluru and Mangaluru. Officials, who had earlier only restricted traffic at night in the ghat section following landslides, prohibited all vehicles from moving in the ghat and suggested alternate routes through Charmadi Ghat and Madikeri to reach Mangaluru.

255.title: Gujarat businessman threatened for uploading Nupur Sharma's pic, 3 held
255.article_body: Three people were arrested after they allegedly threatened a businessman in Gujarat for uploading suspended Bharatiya Janata Party leader Nupur Sharma's picture on Instagram. An official said that the complainant got threats from seven people after uploading the picture. Search is also on for four other accused. The arrested accused have been booked under IPC sections.

256.title: I could retire from football at the age of 55: Italy legend Buffon
256.article_body: Italian legend Gianluigi Buffon, who has previously played for Juventus and PSG, said he could retire from football at the age of 55. "I've been thinking about retirement for 10 years, but...always continued," added Buffon. Revealing the top five foreign players he has played with during his career, Buffon named Lilian Thuram, Neymar, Kylian Mbappe, Cristiano Ronaldo and Zlatan Ibrahimović.

257.title: Australia reinstates COVID-19 quarantine payments amid rising cases
257.article_body: Australian PM Anthony Albanese said the country will reinstate support payments for casual workers who have to quarantine due to COVID-19. The leave payments, which ended on June 30 and entitled workers to get up to A$750 ($510) for each seven-day quarantine period, will remain in place until September-end, he added. This comes amid rising COVID-19 cases in the country.

258.title: Tempo driver attacked after bike, tempo collide in Pune; 2 booked
258.article_body: A case has been filed against two brothers for allegedly assaulting a tempo driver after the bike the duo was riding hit the latter's vehicle in Pune's Ghotawade Phata. The tempo driver had offered to treat the bike's rider, however, the duo called their relatives and attacked the former, according to the complaint. The incident occurred on July 12.

259.title: Punjab woman held for killing 4-yr-old son says 'Killed daughter 10 yrs ago'
259.article_body: A woman who was arrested for killing her four-year-old son in Punjab's Ludhiana has also confessed to killing her daughter 10 years ago. "Babita confessed to killing her six-year-old daughter, 10 years ago. She also admitted to terminated two pregnancies by hitting her abdomen with a hard substance to induce a miscarriage," police said.

260.title: Breach in drain floods fields, damages crop on 150 acres in Punjab
260.article_body: A breach in a seasonal drain on Friday flooded fields and damaged paddy crops spread over 150 acres in the Patti sub-division of Punjab's Tarn Taran amid heavy rainfall. About 12 farmers were affected by the incident. One of the farmers claimed, "The fields won't dry up for many days and I'll not be able to sow the paddy again."

261.title: I told Saudi Crown Prince I hold him responsible for Khashoggi's murder: Biden
261.article_body: US President Joe Biden on Friday said that he told Saudi Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman that he held him responsible for the murder of Washington Post journalist Jamal Khashoggi. "He basically said that he was not personally responsible for it," Biden said of the Crown Prince's response during their meeting.

262.title: 23-yr-old girl defeats Union Minister's sister in MP panchayat polls
262.article_body: A 23-year-old girl has defeated Union Minister of State Faggan Singh Kulaste's sister in the recently held three-tier panchayat elections in Madhya Pradesh's Mandla district. According to reports, Lalita Dhurve, who contested with the support of Gondwana Gantantra Party, defeated Kulaste's sister, Priya Dhurve, by 3900 votes. Lalita is the youngest district panchayat member in the district.

263.title: AAP to support Opposition's Presidential candidate Yashwant Sinha
263.article_body: Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) Rajya Sabha MP Sanjay Singh on Saturday said that the party will support the Opposition's Presidential candidate Yashwant Sinha. "We respect Droupadi Murmu but we will vote for Yashwant Sinha," he added. Notably, AAP has 92 MLAs and seven Rajya Sabha MPs. Earlier, Shiv Sena announced its support for Droupadi Murmu for Presidential elections.

264.title: Heavy to extremely heavy rainfall warning in several states; IMD releases list
264.article_body: The India Meteorological Department has predicted isolated heavy rainfall over Madhya Pradesh, Coastal Karnataka, Goa, Kerala, Chhattisgarh, Coastal Andhra Pradesh, Gujarat, Maharashtra, Tamil Nadu and Telangana between July 16 and 20. Isolated very heavy rainfall is expected over Odisha, Himachal Pradesh, while Uttarakhand and Uttar Pradesh will likely receive extremely heavy rainfall.

265.title: Mumbai Police seize e-cigarettes, flavoured tobacco; 11 arrested
265.article_body: The Mumbai Police seized electronic cigarettes and flavoured tobacco, worth over ₹14.60 lakh, after conducting raids at 12 different locations in the city. Also, during the operation, which was carried out by the Crime Branch control of the Economic Offences Wing, 11 people were arrested in connection with the case, an official said.

266.title: 11 more die in Gujarat due to heavy rains, toll reaches 54
266.article_body: The death toll due to heavy rains in Gujarat reached up to 54 as 11 more people died in a day. Disaster Management Minister Rajendra Trivedi said the deaths were caused by drowning, wall collapse and electrocution. "Three of them fell off a bridge and died," Trivedi said. Purna and Ambika rivers overflowed at three places, he added.

267.title: India needed a knock like Stokes' in 2019 WC final: Giles on 2nd ODI
267.article_body: Reacting to India's 100-run defeat in the second ODI against England, ex-England spinner Ashley Giles said India needed a batter to play a knock just like Ben Stokes played in the 2019 World Cup final. "Someone needs to take the game by the scruff of the neck," added Giles. Stokes scored 84* as England beat New Zealand in the final.

268.title: Twitter's sudden speed for trial after 2 months of foot-dragging is a tactic: Musk
268.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk has opposed Twitter's request for a fast-track trial over the $44 billion deal termination. In a filing, Musk said, "Twitter's sudden request for warp speed after two months of foot-dragging...is its latest tactic to shroud the truth about spam accounts long enough to railroad defendants into closing." Twitter has requested that the trial begin in September.

269.title: Irrfan Khan wanted to be an 'urban farmer', says wife Sutapa Sikdar
269.article_body: Late actor Irrfan Khan wanted to be an 'urban farmer', his wife Sutapa Sikdar said. Sutapa, on Friday, shared a picture of their son Ayan holding a bunch of bananas and wrote, "When...your boy is trying to look like...farmer in...village market." After a user commented, "Our in-house farmer," Sutapa responded, "Yes, urban farmer what his father truly wanted to become."

270.title: J&K's Kishtwar to become North India's major power hub: MoS Jitendra Singh
270.article_body: Union Minister of State Jitendra Singh said J&K's Kishtwar will become a major power hub in North India with nearly 6,000 MW of electricity after completion of the ongoing power projects. "The surplus power from Kishtwar will...also be sold to other states," he added. The minister further announced 100% reservation for locals in the projects undertaken in the region.

271.title: Took Baahubali for people to understand south is at par with world: Regina
271.article_body: Actress Regina Cassandra, who predominantly works in the Tamil and Telugu film industries, has said it has taken films like 'Baahubali' to make people understand that south cinema is capable of being at par with world cinema. "We've always had...small-budget Tamil and Telugu films that had won major laurels...And, I guess everything was just a matter of time," she added.

272.title: Udhampur's Reetika Sharma tops J&K 10th board exams, wants to join Army
272.article_body: Reetika Sharma from Jammu and Kashmir's Udhampur district has topped the Class 10th state board exams by scoring 499 out of 500 marks or 99.8%. Sharma, whose father is a daily wager in the PWD department, said she wanted to become an officer in the Indian Army by clearing the NDA or the UPSC exams.

273.title: Jharkhand to implement old pension scheme; give 100 units of free electricity
273.article_body: Jharkhand cabinet approved proposals to implement the old pension scheme and provide 100 units of free electricity per month to financially weaker consumers. A committee will be formed to draft the SOP for going back to the old pension scheme. The cabinet also approved the rules and regulations for 75% reservation in private sector jobs for local residents of Jharkhand.

274.title: WB trader saves coins worth ₹1.8 lakh, uses it to buy motorbike
274.article_body: A trader in West Bengal's Nadia who saved coins worth ₹1.8 lakh over six years has used them to buy a motorbike. The trader said that he sent bags and sacks of coins to buy the motorbike after getting the showroom's permission. "[Trader] paid around ₹1.5 lakh," showroom's manager said. The showroom's employees took almost three days to count coins.

275.title: Drunk US pilot arrested after landing plane on highway
275.article_body: An intoxicated pilot was arrested on Friday in US' Missouri after he landed his plane on a highway. The pilot had reportedly landed the aircraft after radioing that he had run out of fuel. The plane had a "minor collision" with a guardrail upon landing, but no other damage was caused, authorities said. Drugs were also recovered from his possession.

276.title: San Francisco International Airport terminal evacuated after bomb threat
276.article_body: Hundreds of passengers were evacuated from the San Francisco International Airport's international terminal on Friday night after a bomb threat. A man has been taken into custody after the police found a suspicious package they described as a potentially "incendiary" device. The airport's AirTrain and the Bay Area Rapid Transit trains were also suspended following the bomb threat.

277.title: One more held after Bihar Police busts anti-India campaign WhatsApp group
277.article_body: Bihar Police arrested one more member of the banned outfit  Popular Front of India (PFI) after an anti-India campaign WhatsApp group 'Gajwa-e-Hind' was busted in Patna. Earlier, police arrested three persons, including a retired sub-inspector of Jharkhand Police. Bihar Police had seized a document called 'Vision 2047, India towards the rule of an Islamic state'.

278.title: Feel really bad for not taking Aamir's advice on acting seriously: Ranbir
278.article_body: Actor Ranbir Kapoor said he feels "really bad" for not taking Aamir Khan's advice on acting before he started starring in films "seriously", having considered it "really silly" back then. Ranbir added Aamir advised him "very strongly" to travel around India and experience different cultures as well as meet people. "That would've added another dimension to my creativity," he stated.

279.title: Activist Teesta got money from Cong leader Patel to frame then CM Modi in Guj riots: SIT
279.article_body: Social activist Teesta Setalvad, former state Director General of Police (DGP) RB Sreekumar and former IPS officer Sanjeev Bhatt had accepted ₹30 lakh from late Congress leader Ahmed Patel to frame then Gujarat CM Narendra Modi in the 2002 Gujarat riots, a SIT report revealed. The SIT was formed to probe Setalvad along with Sreekumar for criminal conspiracy and forgery.

280.title: Virat Kohli attends Krishna Das' kirtan with Anushka in London, pics surface
280.article_body: Team India batter Virat Kohli attended Krishna Das' kirtan with Anushka Sharma in London, with pictures surfacing online. "Lovely meeting and chanting with you both. Ram Ram!" a devotee wrote on Instagram while sharing pictures. Krishna Das is an American vocalist known for his performances of Hindu devotional music. He has performed at Grammy Awards as well.

281.title: 8-year-old girl molested by 52-year-old JNU lab attendant on campus
281.article_body: A 52-year-old Jawaharlal Nehru University lab attendant has been arrested for allegedly molesting an eight-year-old girl on campus when she had gone for her tuition, police said on Friday. Police added that the accused's son gives tuition to students. The girl told her father about the incident after which he called the police, the police further said.

282.title: Jet fuel prices cut by 2.2%; second reduction this year
282.article_body: Aviation Turbine Fuel prices were reduced by 2.2% on Saturday, reflecting a fall in international oil prices. The prices were cut by ₹3,084.94 per kilolitre to ₹1,38,147.93/kl. This is only the second reduction in rates this year. Prices had peaked at ₹1,41,232.87/kl last month. Overall, ATF rates have been hiked 11 times since the start of this year.

283.title: South films dubbed in Hindi, audience alive: Arjun on South vs B'wood debate
283.article_body: When asked what or where is Hindi cinema going wrong as Bollywood movies are not making it as big as films from the South, actor Arjun Kapoor said, "Films...are being dubbed and are coming out in Hindi...that is big sign." "English films that come they get dubbed...the Hindi viewing audience is existing. They are alive," he added.

284.title: Govt releases pics of ₹14,850 crore Bundelkhand Expressway inaugurated by PM Modi
284.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Saturday visited Uttar Pradesh and inaugurated 296 km four-lane Bundelkhand Expressway, which has been constructed at a cost of around ₹14,850 crore, the government stated. It extends from NH-35 at Gonda village near Bharatkoop in Chitrakoot district to near Kudrail village in Etawah district, where it merges with the Agra-Lucknow expressway.

285.title: Man rapes teen girl as his wife records crime and uploads it on social media in UP
285.article_body: A man and his wife have been arrested in Uttar Pradesh's Budaun after he allegedly raped a teen girl while his wife recorded the act and uploaded the video on social media, police said. According to police, the teenager in her complaint said that on July 12, the man had called her to his house and raped her.

286.title: JD(S) to support NDA candidate Droupadi Murmu in Presidential polls
286.article_body: JD(S) announced on Friday that it will be supporting NDA candidate Droupadi Murmu in the upcoming Presidential polls. "A tribal woman becoming the president of the country is a matter of pride. The selection...is according to the wish of Deve Gowda," JD(S)' deputy leader in the legislature Bandeppa Kashempur said. Murmu will contest against opposition's Presidential candidate Yashwant Sinha.

287.title: 72-yr-old woman robbed, assaulted inside her house in Faridabad; 2 arrested
287.article_body: A 72-year-old woman was allegedly robbed and assaulted inside her house by two men in Sector 4, Faridabad. One of the accused, Amit Kumar, used to deliver mineral water to the victim, Jaywati Sharma's house and had planned the crime with his friend Raj Tyagi, police said. Notably, both the suspects were arrested from Bulandshahr in Uttar Pradesh.

288.title: Pick-up van rams into stationary truck in H'yana; 3 dead, 7 injured
288.article_body: Three people, including a woman, were killed and about seven others were injured after a pick-up van rammed into a stationary truck on the national highway in Haryana's Sonipat on Friday. "The front portion of the [pick-up van] was severely damaged in the collision," a police spokesperson said. The injured people have been admitted to hospitals, the police spokesperson added.

289.title: Amitabh's granddaughter Navya makes her screen debut, shares teaser
289.article_body: Navya Naveli Nanda, daughter of Shweta Bachchan Nanda and granddaughter of Amitabh Bachchan, has made her on-screen debut with an advertisement for a makeup brand. She took to Instagram to share a teaser of the advertisement. Reacting to it, Ananya Panday wrote in the comments section, "Omg!!!! Love you...so excited for you," while Shanaya Kapoor commented, "Amazing."

290.title: Unarmed black man, who was killed by US police, was shot 46 times: Doctor
290.article_body: A 25-year-old black man killed by Ohio police last month was shot 46 times, medical examiner Lisa Kohler said. She added that her autopsy also determined that Jayland Walker had no drugs or alcohol in his system when he was killed on June 27 after police officers tried to pull him over for a minor traffic violation and he fled.

291.title: Rishi Sunak responds after people troll him for spelling error in UK PM campaign poster
291.article_body: Rishi Sunak has responded after social media users trolled him over a spelling error in his UK PM campaign poster. During a television debate viewers pointed out that campaign was misspelt as "campiaign" in Sunak's poster. Sunak responded saying, "Ready for spellcheck" in a tweak of his slogan 'Ready for Rishi'.

292.title: Amazon pauses work on 6 new US office buildings to redesign for hybrid work
292.article_body: Amazon is pausing construction of six new office buildings in Bellevue and Nashville as it seeks to redesign workspaces for hybrid work. "We want to make sure that we design them in a way that meets our employees' needs in future," Amazon said. Amazon's plan to create 30,000 jobs in Bellevue and Nashville won't be affected by the construction pause.

293.title: Absence of democracy in J&K feeding alienation: National Conference
293.article_body: The J&K National Conference Party said the "absence of democracy" in Jammu and Kashmir is "feeding alienation" among the people of the Union Territory. "There is disquieting evidence everywhere in J&K on the backsliding of democracy," MPs Mohammad Akbar Lone and Hasnain Masoodi said on Friday. "A remote-controlled system can't empathise with people's suffering...aspirations," they added.

294.title: Would've been fine if Kohli was getting out in 1st 10-12 balls: Ajay Jadeja
294.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Ajay Jadeja said it would have been fine if Virat Kohli was getting dismissed within the first 10 to 12 balls, as any batter can be dismissed during that phase. "I would...worry that he is getting 20s and 30s," added Ajay. Kohli was dismissed for 16 in the second ODI against England which India lost by 100 runs.

295.title: It's one role which will be difficult to play: Mahesh on becoming grandfather
295.article_body: Mahesh Bhatt, who is all set to become a grandfather to Alia Bhatt and Ranbir Kapoor's child, has said getting into grandfather's role would be difficult. "This is one role which will be a little difficult to play," he said. Mahesh added that he is very proud of his daughter's achievements. Alia announced her pregnancy on Instagram in June.

296.title: People climbed on my car during 'Qayamat..', driver said, 'You're hit': Neha
296.article_body: Actress Neha Dhupia said people climbed on top of her car during the screening of her debut movie 'Qayamat: City Under Threat'. She said that it caused a dent on the roof of her car and that when she reached hotel, her driver said she has become a hit. "You know, [it's one of the] things that stay," she added.

297.title: Pant overthinking in white-ball cricket, looks careless in Tests: Vaughan
297.article_body: Discussing Rishabh Pant's dismissal for a duck in the second ODI against England, having scored 146 in the fifth Test against the same opposition, ex-England captain Michael Vaughan said Pant is overthinking while batting in white-ball cricket. "In [Tests], it just looks like a careless approach," added Vaughan. "I would say to...Pant, don't be ultra-aggressive," he stated.

298.title: Ukraine receives 1st M270 multiple rocket launch systems
298.article_body: Ukrainian Defence Minister Oleksii Reznikov said Ukraine has received the first M270 multiple rocket launch systems, without specifying which country provided them. The M270, which carries a load of 12 rockets on a mobile launcher, "will be good company" for US-made High Mobility Artillery Rocket Systems (HIMARS) on battlefield, he added. So far, US has provided eight HIMARS to Ukraine.

299.title: Dasna Devi temple priest booked in Ghaziabad for abusing Mahatma Gandhi
299.article_body: An FIR was lodged against priest Yati Narsinghanand in Ghaziabad's Masuri Police Station after a video resurfaced in which the Dasna Devi temple head priest was hurling abuses at Mahatma Gandhi. The video is five-six months old and the likely location is Haridwar, police said. The FIR states that Yati held Gandhi responsible for the murders of Hindus during Partition.

300.title: Oil trader who cheated wholesaler of ₹8.54 crore booked in Pune
300.article_body: Pune's Market Yard police have filed a case against an oil trader for allegedly cheating a wholesaler of ₹8.54 crore after the former failed to provide edible oil that the latter had paid for. The accused reportedly cheated the wholesaler despite repeated requests for a refund. The wholesaler gave the money to the accused in November 2021, according to FIR.

301.title: Former Punjab speaker and senior SAD leader Nirmal Singh Kahlon dies at 79
301.article_body: Senior Shiromani Akali Dal (SAD) leader and former Punjab Vidhan Sabha Speaker Nirmal Singh Kahlon has passed away aged 79, Shiromani Akali Dal chief Sukhbir Singh Badal said. "Kahlon sahab was a source of inspiration for all of us. His wise counsel will always be missed. I stand with the Kahlon family in this hour of grief," Badal tweeted.

302.title: BJP wants Cong-free India, now they're after regional parties: Gehlot
302.article_body: Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot on Friday claimed that BJP wants a "Congress-mukt Bharat (Congress-free India)" and now, they're after regional parties. "They want that...entire country is ruled by the BJP and RSS," he added. He further said that a "very dangerous game" is happening and people "aren't speaking out of fear" of Enforcement Directorate, Income Tax Department and CBI.

303.title: No retest for students who missed CUET on first day: UGC chairman
303.article_body: Students who missed Central University Entrance Test (CUET) on the first day after reaching the exam centres late will not be offered a retest, UGC chairman M Jagadesh Kumar said. Notably, students from several cities claimed they missed the test due to sudden changes in centres. The first-ever CUET is being conducted by the National Testing Agency in two phases.

304.title: Girl with Down syndrome killed by Russian missile on her way to speech therapist
304.article_body: A 4-year-old girl with Down syndrome was killed by a Russian missile on her way to see a speech therapist with her mother in Ukraine. Liza was among 23 people killed in Thursday's missile strike in Vinnytsia. Her mother, Iryna Dmytrieva, lost a leg. "The mother was robbed of the most precious thing she had," Iryna's aunt said.

305.title: Which states have the highest active COVID-19 cases as 20,044 new cases reported?
305.article_body: West Bengal has the highest number of active COVID-19 cases at 30,043 as the country reported 20,044 new cases in the last 24 hours. It is followed by Kerala (24,953), Tamil Nadu (17,487), Maharashtra (16,000) and Karnataka (6,702). Active cases in the country stand at 1,40,760, while the death toll has risen to 5,25,660.

306.title: Russian space agency chief Dmitry, known for clashes with Musk, fired
306.article_body: Dmitry Rogozin, the Russian space agency chief who had frequent clashes online with SpaceX CEO Elon Musk, has been fired. While Kremlin did not provide a reason for removing him, Rogozin’s exit occurred on the same day that NASA and Roscosmos reached terms on a new agreement to collaborate on International Space Station missions despite the ongoing situation in Ukraine.

307.title: Elected govts are toppled for not accepting BJP's ideology: NCP chief
307.article_body: NCP chief Sharad Pawar on Friday accused BJP-led central leadership of imposing their ideology on state governments run by non-BJP parties. He alleged that democratically elected governments in states are toppled if they don't accept BJP's ideology. "But such things do not last...wherever autocracy took over in the world, it didn't last long," he told a gathering of NCP workers.

308.title: Traffic curbs issued in Secunderabad for Ujjaini Mahakali Bonalu festival
308.article_body: Hyderabad City Police has issued traffic restrictions in view of Ujjaini Mahakali Bonalu festival on July 17 and 18 in Secunderabad. Motorists have been asked to avoid stretches and junctions in the two-kilometre radius of Sri Ujjaini Mahakali Temple. Police further asked people to avoid roads and junctions of Karbala Maidan, Ranigunj, Bible house and Ramgopalpet.

309.title: Pakistani woman crosses LoC at night in J&K's Poonch, arrested
309.article_body: A 49-year-old Pakistani woman was arrested by the Indian Army after she crossed the Line of Control (LoC) in Jammu and Kashmir's Poonch on Friday night, officials said. The woman, Rozina, is a resident of Pakistan's Islamabad, the officials added. Earlier this month, the BSF handed over a three-year-old Pakistani boy to his family after he inadvertently entered India.

310.title: Smartwatch-like wearable that operates without a battery developed in US
310.article_body: Researchers at the University of California, Irvine, have developed a smartwatch-like wearable that can operate without an external power source or a battery. The 3D printed device is capable of keeping a track of the wearer's pulse and communicating wirelessly with a nearby smartphone. It uses an ultra-thin 2D material called MXene, which has unique electrical and mechanical properties.

311.title: 'No prayers permitted' sign put up at Lulu mall in UP after men seen offering namaz
311.article_body: Lulu Group's biggest Indian mall in UP's Lucknow has put up a sign stating 'No religious prayers will be permitted in the mall'. This comes as police filed an FIR after a video showed some men offering namaz inside the newly opened mall. Meanwhile, police on Friday detained three people for attempting to recite Sundarkand at the mall.

312.title: Infosys Science Foundation opens first office in Bengaluru
312.article_body: The Infosys Science Foundation, the not-for-profit Trust set up in 2009 by IT major Infosys, inaugurated its first office in Bengaluru's Jayanagar on Thursday. The opening ceremony was attended by Infosys Co-founders Narayana Murthy and Kris Gopalakrishnan. "This building has offices for ISF professionals, several conference rooms, a 100-seater technology-enabled auditorium," said Murthy.

313.title: Don't like my songs in other films, will take legal route next time: Rajiv Rai
313.article_body: Director Rajiv Rai said that he will take the legal route next time his songs are being recreated and used in another movie. "I do not like people putting my songs in other films...The problem is when you take a piece from say 'Mohra' and put it in another film and then claim that it's yours," he added.

314.title: 150 students fall sick after eating lunch at IIIT-Basar hostel in Telangana
314.article_body: Nearly 150 students of the Rajiv Gandhi University of Knowledge Technologies, also known as IIIT-Basar in Telangana's Nirmal district, fell sick after they ate lunch at the hostel on Friday. "All students are stable now...600 students had lunch on the campus," Telangana Minister Indrakaran Reddy said. As many as 23 students were shifted to a hospital, he added.

315.title: Arjun's 'Kuttey' to clash with Katrina's 'Phone Bhoot' on November 4
315.article_body: Arjun Kapoor's upcoming film 'Kuttey' is set to clash with Katrina Kaif, Ishaan Khatter and Siddhant Chaturvedi-starrer 'Phone Bhoot' on November 4. 'Kuttey', which also stars Konkona Sensharma, Naseeruddin Shah, Kumud Mishra, Radhika Madan and Tabu, is being directed by Aasmaan Bhardwaj. Meanwhile, 'Phone Bhoot' is a horror comedy directed by Gurmmeet Singh.

316.title: You need to make tough decisions: Hogg on Kohli's selection for T20 WC
316.article_body: Discussing Virat Kohli's potential selection in India's squad for T20 World Cup 2022, ex-Australia spinner Brad Hogg said, "You need to make tough decisions." "The game has been more aggressive. You're scoring at higher rates and taking on the bowling...There are a few decisions that India [have] to make," he added. "You pick your best XI for the...team," stated Hogg.

317.title: Join our Look Good Feel Good initiative: Raymond
317.article_body: Raymond believes that giving never goes out of style which is why it's always the season of giving at Raymond. Customers can pledge their pre-owned garments to the underprivileged and there will be a special gift for them in the store, like complimentary vouchers for trouser stitching. "Join our initiative to make millions smile," it stated.

318.title: Award-winning Dr. Soni suggests Get Slim Juice for weight loss: Kapiva
318.article_body: 90% of Get Slim Juice users claimed that the juice helps with weight loss, reduces cravings, and improves energy levels, shared Kapiva Ayurveda. Dr. Kriti Soni, R&D Head, Kapiva, also shared that the combination of 12 Ayurvedic herbs effectively boosts metabolism and reduces fat accumulation. To support this, Kapiva also provides a free diet and yoga plan with doctor consultation.

319.title: World's biggest NFT marketplace OpenSea fires 20% staff citing 'crypto winter'
319.article_body: The world's first and biggest NFT marketplace OpenSea has fired 20% of its employees citing "cryptocurrency winter" and "broad macroeconomic instability". CEO Devin Finzer shared the news on Twitter and said the affected employees will be provided with a generous severance and healthcare coverage into 2023. He added that the company will also help in the placement of these employees.

320.title: Consider adoption: HC to woman seeking to terminate 23-week pregnancy
320.article_body: Delhi HC on Friday said that it will not permit a 25-year-old unmarried woman to undergo termination of her 23-week pregnancy. It asked the woman to consider delivering the child who can be given up for adoption. "We will ensure...the girl is kept somewhere safe and she can deliver and go. There is a big queue for adoption," HC stated.

321.title: Waterbomber pilot dies fighting Portugal wildfire after plane crash
321.article_body: A pilot died on Friday after his waterbomber aircraft crashed while trying to contain a raging wildfire in northern Portugal, authorities said. The wildfire in Torre de Moncorvo is one of nine blazes sweeping across Portugal amid a heatwave. The fires have burnt more than 30,000 hectares of land so far this year, according to Portuguese state television RTP.

322.title: Boris Johnson said 'back anyone for UK PM but Rishi Sunak': Report
322.article_body: Amid the process to choose UK's next Prime Minister, caretaker Prime Minister Boris Johnson reportedly told his allies to "back anyone but Rishi Sunak". The five remaining Conservative candidates to become Britain's next PM include Sunak, Penny Mordaunt, Liz Truss, Kemi Badenoch and Tom Tugendhat. Sunak was the winner of the first two rounds of voting.

323.title: 7-yr-old boy dies as part of roof collapses in Raj amid heavy rainfall
323.article_body: A seven-year-old boy lost his life after a part of a house roof collapsed in Rajasthan's Ganganagar amid heavy rainfall. The authorities have advised people to not move out of their homes. Reports said that extremely heavy rainfall of 260 mm was recorded in Ganganagar in 24 hours ending 8.30 am on Friday.

324.title: 5 of family arrested in Faridabad for defrauding over 200 with fake gold items
324.article_body: Five members of a family were arrested by the Faridabad Police for allegedly defrauding over 200 people across India by selling them fake gold coins, ornaments and others. The family, which lived in Ballabgarh, used to claim the fake items as "Mughal-era artifacts" that were unearthed during excavations. The accused had made crores of rupees through this racket, police said.

325.title: Signed 'Mirzapur' after reading 2 episodes: Shweta Tripathi Sharma
325.article_body: Actress Shweta Tripathi Sharma has said she doesn't do projects for money, adding, "I did 'Mirzapur' after reading two episodes, out of which my character was not even there in the first episode." The actress, who plays a character named Golu on the show, added that she just wanted to be a part of the world that was created.

326.title: Ricky Martin accused of having sexual relation with 21-year-old nephew
326.article_body: Singer Ricky Martin has been accused of having a sexual relationship with his 21-year-old nephew, who allegedly earlier accused him of domestic violence. Martin faces up to 50 years in jail in Puerto Rico, according to reports. Martin's lawyer denied the allegations, saying the idea of having sexual or romantic relationship with his nephew isn't only untrue but also "disgusting".

327.title: Sanjay said, 'You're woking out in gym for 2 yrs, body doesn't show': Ranbir
327.article_body: At a 'Shamshera' event, actor Ranbir Kapoor said he used to work out in actor Sanjay Dutt's gym during 'Barfi' and 'Rockstar'. "He used to tell me, 'You are working out for the past two years, but your body doesn't show it'," Ranbir added. Ranbir further said that Dutt has always had his back and has always inspired him.

328.title: Twitter's lawsuit against Musk gets 90-min 1st court hearing on July 19
328.article_body: Twitter’s lawsuit against Tesla CEO Elon Musk over terminating the $44 billion acquisition deal will be first heard in court on July 19. Kathaleen McCormick, the Chancellor of Delaware's Court of Chancery, has set a 90-minute hearing. Notably, Twitter has requested that the trial begins in September because the merger agreement with Musk terminates on October 25.

329.title: Tried social media for 2 days, lost 5 years of my life: Shamshera maker
329.article_body: Karan Malhotra, the director of Ranbir Kapoor-starrer 'Shamshera', said, "I tried [social media] for two...days and lost five years of my life." Discussing whether she could convince Ranbir to join Instagram, the film's actress Vaani Kapoor said, "He won't listen to me. [Director] Siddharth Anand came on social media during release of 'War' and deleted his account after its release."

330.title: Mumbai to get 5 new air quality monitors in 2022, locations to be decided
330.article_body: Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) is set to install and operate five of its own Continuous Ambient Air Quality Monitoring Stations (CAAQMS) in the city by the end of 2022. "The locations of proposed monitors have not been decided but we will be installing them in places or wards which are not yet covered by the existing network," an official said.

331.title: US, Saudi Arabia agree on stopping Iran from getting nuclear weapon
331.article_body: The US and Saudi Arabia agreed on the importance of stopping Iran from "acquiring a nuclear weapon" during a visit by US President Joe Biden to the Arab nation, a joint statement read. Both countries also "underscored the need to further deter Iran's interference in...internal affairs of other countries, its support for terrorism...and its efforts to destabilise...the region", it added.

332.title: Tansa dam supplying drinking water to Mumbai full, public caution advised
332.article_body: Tansa dam, which is one of the seven reservoirs that supply drinking water to Mumbai, is full due to heavy rainfall, officials announced on Thursday. Public caution was also advised in view of the development. "We have warned the people residing downstream of the Tansa river about the possibility of rising water levels," Palghar District Collector Manik Gursal said.

333.title: Hyd police officer helps man who fell after getting electric shock
333.article_body: Hyderabad City Police on Saturday said that a police constable, Abdul Khadeer, gave CPR to a 25-year-old man who fell after getting an electric shock while putting up a decorative arch at Secunderabad's Maisamma Temple. The man was then taken to a hospital where he received treatment before being discharged, police added. The incident occurred on Thursday, police further said.

334.title: Bengaluru Police conducts drive against begging, 43 rescued
334.article_body: Bengaluru Police, the Department of Women and Child Development and members of multiple NGOs jointly conducted a drive against begging at the city's traffic junctions on Friday. As many as 43 people, including 28 children and 15 mothers, found begging at the junctions were rescued. The rescued children were handed over to the Child Welfare Committee, said police.

335.title: Bodies of 2 school students found on railway tracks in UP's Gorakhpur
335.article_body: The bodies of two school students were found on the railway tracks in Uttar Pradesh's Gorakhpur, police said. The bodies are of a Class 12 student and a Class 11 student, and they both used to study in the same school, police added. Reportedly, both were having an affair and wanted to marry but their families were against it.

336.title: Organs of brain-dead woman save 5 lives, including 2 soldiers, in Pune
336.article_body: The organs of a 34-year-old woman, who was declared brain dead, saved five lives at Pune's Command Hospital on Thursday night. Her organs such as both kidneys were transplanted into two serving soldiers of the Indian Army, a hospital official said. Her liver was retrieved by a team of surgeons from Ruby Hall Clinic for a patient at their hospital.

337.title: Ireland record their highest-ever ODI total, lose 3rd ODI to New Zealand by 1 run
337.article_body: Ireland recorded their highest-ever total in ODI cricket by registering 359/9 while chasing a target of 361 against New Zealand in the third ODI in Dublin. Ireland lost the match by 1 run as New Zealand clinched the three-match series 3-0. Ireland's previous highest ODI total had come on March 7, 2015, when they scored 331/8 against Zimbabwe.

338.title: Hyd civic body to train unemployed youth from economically weaker sections
338.article_body: Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation (GHMC) has tied up with Lighthouse Communities Foundation (LCF) to provide skill development training to unemployed youth belonging to economically weaker sections. Under the programme, youth aged 18-35 years will be trained across various fields including IT, web designing and nursing. The initiative will be launched in Serilingampally Zone on pilot basis.

339.title: 21-yr-old student dies by suicide over fear of placement in Pune
339.article_body: A 21-year-old engineering student allegedly died by suicide by jumping from the eighth floor of a residential building in Pune on Friday. As per a purported suicide note, the deceased did so as he feared that he wouldn't get any job placement, police said. The deceased has been identified as a fourth-year student at a college in the city.

340.title: Maria Sharapova welcomes first child with fiancé; shares pic
340.article_body: Maria Sharapova took to social media to share the news of the birth of her son. The baby, named Theodore, is the first child of Sharapova and her fiancé Alexander Gilkes. The former world number one women's tennis player posted a picture and wrote, "The most beautiful, challenging, and rewarding gift our little family could ask for."

341.title: Murali creates history, becomes 1st Indian man to reach long jump final at World C'ships
341.article_body: Long jumper Murali Sreeshankar has created history by becoming the first Indian man to qualify for the long jump final in the history of World Athletics Championships. The 23-year-old registered a best jump of 8m to reach the final at the 2022 World Athletics Championships in US' Eugene. Meanwhile, India's Avinash Sable qualified for the 3,000m steeplechase final.

342.title: Unjustifiable request: Musk files motion against Twitter's bid to fast-track trial
342.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk has filed a motion opposing Twitter's request to fast-track a trial over the $44 billion deal, terming it an "unjustifiable request". While Twitter has requested the trial begin in September because the merger agreement with Musk terminates on October 25, Musk has requested a trial date on or after February 13, 2023.

343.title: Ivana Trump died of accidental blunt impact injuries to torso: Medical examiner
343.article_body: Ivana Trump, former US President Donald Trump's first wife, died of "blunt impact injuries" to the torso, the New York City medical examiner's office has said. It added that the death of the 73-year-old was accidental. Reports in US media said that she died after falling down stairs in her New York City apartment.

344.title: No selector born in India yet who can drop Kohli: Ex-Pakistan captain Rashid Latif
344.article_body: On being asked if Virat Kohli should be dropped, former Pakistan captain Rashid Latif said, "There is no selector born in India yet who can drop Kohli." He also stated, "You are talking about one player, but the entire Indian team isn't winning consistently either. You are putting the gun on Virat's shoulders and keeping the other players safe."

345.title: Delhi businessman kills wife, 2 daughters and self over business loss
345.article_body: A 40-year-old businessman allegedly shot himself dead after killing his wife and two minor daughters over failure in business, police said. He was in jeans business and faced huge losses, police added. Before killing himself, the businessman made a video stating he killed his daughters since they would face problems in future but spared his sons because they would manage.

346.title: She didn't tell me she's dating Lalit Modi, got to know through media: Sushmita's father
346.article_body: Actress Sushmita Sen's father Shubeer Sen has said that he got to know that his daughter is dating former IPL Chairman Lalit Modi through media. "I had a telephonic conversation with her on Friday morning...but she did not tell me anything...I was informed after the tweet from Lalit Modi only by media persons," he added.

347.title: Doctor recommended cannabis use: Griner amid Russia drug trial
347.article_body: Jailed American basketball player Brittney Griner's lawyer has submitted to a Russian court a US doctor's note recommending the WNBA star use medical cannabis to treat pain. Griner was detained at Moscow airport in February after cannabis oil was allegedly found in her luggage. If found guilty of transporting drugs, she faces up to 10 years in a Russian jail.

348.title: Kerur violence victim's wife throws ₹2 lakh aid at Siddaramaiah's car
348.article_body: Former Karnataka CM Siddaramaiah gave a compensation of ₹2 lakh to a woman whose husband was injured in the Kerur communal violence. However, the woman threw back the money at the Congress leader's car. The woman, identified as Mohammad Haneef's wife Rajma, said, "Today they'll give compensation and go away...My husband can't work for another year because of the assault."

349.title: Former Gambian spy chief sentenced to death
