349.article_body: A court in Gambia has sentenced the country's former spy chief, Yankuba Badjie and four others to death for the killing of a political activist in 2016. Ebrima Solo Sandeng, an opposition party leader at the time, was killed at the intelligence agency's head office in the capital Banjul. Badjie was convicted along with four other former intelligence officials.

350.title: Putin reshuffles his senior ministers amid Ukraine war
350.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin on Friday reshuffled his senior ministers, removing the weapons industries charge from Deputy Prime Minister Yuri Borisov. This came amid reported flaws in Russian weaponry highlighted by the invasion of Ukraine. Denis Manturov was elevated to the rank of Deputy Prime Minister and will simultaneously handle the ministries of weapons industries and trade.

351.title: Wimbledon champ Rybakina to donate £2-mn prize money to juniors, animal charity
351.article_body: Elena Rybakina, who became the first Kazakh player to win a Grand Slam at Wimbledon 2022, said she would like to donate the majority of her £2 million prize money to juniors and some of it to the animal shelter. The 23-year-old, who was born in Moscow and shifted to Kazakhstan in 2018, defeated Ons Jabeur in the Wimbledon final.

352.title: Go and cause chaos, he's such a good player: Vaughan to Pant
352.article_body: Reacting to Rishabh Pant's form in limited-overs series against England, Michael Vaughan said ​​the India wicketkeeper-batter needs to be more aggressive. "He has got bat in his hand, go...cause chaos," he added. "He's such a good player, you just want him to have that freedom," he further said. He's scored 26, 1, 0 in limited-overs matches in England so far.

353.title: 1,000 firefighters, 10 water planes battle forest fires in France
353.article_body: A thousand firefighters supported by 10 water-showering planes battled two wildfires in southwest France on Friday as high temperatures and wind gusts complicated operations. The blazes forced the evacuation of 11,300 people in the Bordeaux region. In total, the fire has covered over 7,000 hectares (17,297 acres) of land, according to the regional emergency service.

354.title: Hamas rejects US President's expression of sympathy for Palestine
354.article_body: Gaza's militant group Hamas has rejected US President Joe Biden's expressions of sympathy for Palestine, calling the US "partner in the aggression on our people". Biden, who is currently on a Middle-East visit, pledged $300 million in aid to Palestinians and reiterated support for the two-state solution. Hamas also criticised Palestinian President Mahmoud Abbas for meeting the US president.

355.title: Briton in detention in Ukraine's breakaway region passes away
355.article_body: Paul Urey, a British national who was detained in the self-proclaimed Donetsk People's Republic (DPR), has passed away in detention, an official in Ukraine's breakaway region said on Friday. Urey had died of chronic illnesses and stress, the official added. He was accused of being a mercenary by the government of DPR.

356.title: No Cabinet in Maha amid flood situation will harm people: NCP chief
356.article_body: NCP chief Sharad Pawar on Friday criticised the Maharashtra government and said that no Cabinet of ministers poses a threat to the people of the state amid a developing flood situation. "Two people are running Maharashtra government for [the] past 10 days," Pawar said. "The Cabinet hasn't been formed so far. There is no reason for delay," Pawar said.

357.title: Assam exports 600-kg lemons to UK
357.article_body: Assam exported around 600 kg of lemons to London on Friday as part of an export consignment. "Happy to share that the first consignment of Assam lemon for export to UK has been dispatched from Baksa," Assam Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma said. The lemons have been sent by the producer at the rate of ₹30 per kg, he added.

358.title: Kartik to make cameo in Luv Ranjan's Ranbir, Shraddha-starrer: Report
358.article_body: Actor Kartik Aaryan will be making a special appearance in filmmaker Luv Ranjan's upcoming romantic-comedy film which features Ranbir Kapoor and Shraddha Kapoor, reported Pinkvilla. Kartik and Luv have earlier worked together in 'Pyaar Ka Punchnama', 'Pyaar Ka Punchnama 2', 'Akaash Vani' and 'Sonu Ke Titu Ki Sweety'. Ranbir and Shraddha's untitled film will release in 2023.

359.title: It seemed like Pant had premeditated his shot in 2nd ODI: Ojha
359.article_body: Following Rishabh Pant's 0(5) in second ODI against England, Pragyan Ojha said it seemed like the India wicketkeeper-batter premeditated his shot in match. "He had to check his shot as it was a full-toss delivery...got out while trying to do that," he added. Ojha further said Pant should be given some cushion because of his ability to play match-winning innings.

360.title: Bankrupt crypto lender Celsius reveals it owes users $4.7 billion
360.article_body: Crypto lender Celsius, which has filed for bankruptcy, owes its users $4.7 billion, a filing with the Southern District of New York court revealed. In the filing, the firm also revealed it had a $1.19 billion deficit on its balance sheet. The company blamed the bankruptcy on inflation, the war in Ukraine and the collapse of several other crypto funds.

361.title: 3 teenagers drown while bathing in Jharkhand pond
361.article_body: Three teenagers, aged between 15 and 17, died in a pond in Jharkhand's Deoghar district on Friday, the local police said. The incident took place when the teenagers were bathing in the Nandan Pahar pond. Town police station in-charge MK Mandal said, "A team of NDRF fished out the bodies from the pond."

362.title: Biden becomes 1st US Prez to fly directly from Israel to S Arabia
362.article_body: Joe Biden has become the first US President to fly directly from Israel to Saudi Arabia. Biden met Saudi Arabia's King Salman and Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman soon after arriving in the country. The visit comes as the US attempts to reset its relationship with a country that Biden once pledged to make a "pariah" on the global stage.

363.title: Crypto must come under auto info-exchange mechanism: FM Sitharaman to G20
363.article_body: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman told the group of 20 major economies to consider bringing cryptocurrencies under the ambit of the automatic exchange of information mechanism. The mechanism exists among countries to curb tax evasion. She said that investigations have shown tax evaders resorting to numerous layers of entities to mask their unaccounted wealth.

364.title: Finland replaces Russia as host of 6th leg of ISU Figure Skating Grand Prix
364.article_body: Finland has been named as the new hosts of the sixth leg of Grand Prix of Figure Skating Series after Russia was removed following its invasion of Ukraine, said International Skating Union (ISU). The November 25-27 event will be held in Espoo, Finland. The final will be held in Turin, Italy, from December 8-11.

365.title: Govt plans 'Right to Repair' framework to help consumers get products fixed independently
365.article_body: The government is working on a 'Right to Repair' framework to cut down restrictive practices introduced by some manufacturers so people can get goods such as consumer durables, phones and cars fixed on their own. Farming equipment, mobile phones/tablets, consumer durables and automobiles/automobile equipment are among the sectors identified by a government committee to implement the framework.

366.title: Bagwati in background: Abhay on 11 yrs of 'Zindagi Na Milegi Dobara'
366.article_body: Actor Abhay Deol shared a series of selfies on Instagram, writing in the caption, "It's not what you wear but how you wear it...#bagwatiinthebackgroundof1stpic #cheapbagwati #immacheapbagwati." One of the luxury bags in the film 'Zindagi Na Milegi Dobara', which has completed 11 years since its release, was called Bagwati. The Zoya Akhar directorial also features Hrithik Roshan and Farhan Akhtar.

367.title: BJP appoints Laxmikant Bajpai as chief whip of Rajya Sabha
367.article_body: The Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) has appointed former Uttar Pradesh BJP President Laxmikant Bajpai as the party's chief whip in the Rajya Sabha. "I will discharge this responsibility given by the party leadership with full devotion," Bajpai said on Twitter. Bajpai has replaced Shiv Pratap Shukla who retired as a Member of Parliament from the Rajya Sabha.

368.title: Indian duo of Arjun-Kapila crashes out in Singapore Open men's quarters
368.article_body: Unseeded Indian duo of MR Arjun and Dhruv Kapila crashed out of Singapore Open 2022 after losing to second seeds Mohammad Ahsan and Hendra Setiawan in the men's doubles quarter-final on Friday. The second seeded Indonesian pair defeated Arjun and Kapila 10-21, 21-18, 21-17 in 49 minutes. Earlier in the day, third seeded PV Sindhu entered the women's singles semi-final.

369.title: Will quit politics if any MLA who joined me loses polls: Maha CM
369.article_body: Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde has stated that he'll quit politics if any of the MLAs who joined him loses the next Assembly polls. "I'm confident that all these 50 MLAs will win the elections...If any of them loses, I'll resign from politics," he said. This comes after Shiv Sena MLAs, led by Shinde, rebelled against Uddhav Thackeray's leadership in Maharashtra.

370.title: Punjab HC judge recuses from hearing Bikram Majithia's bail plea
370.article_body: Punjab and Haryana High Court's Justice Anoop Chitkara on Friday recused himself from hearing the bail petition of Shiromani Akali Dal leader Bikram Singh Majithia. A case under the Narcotic Drugs and Psychotropic Substances Act was registered against Majithia in December 2021. On July 4, Punjab and Haryana HC's Justice Augustine George Masih had recused himself in the matter.

371.title: Most road accidents occurred on straight roads in clear weather in 2020: Govt data
371.article_body: Around 65% (2.37 lakh) of all road accidents in India took place on straight roads in 2020, government data has shown. Such accidents killed over 85,000 people, the 'Road accidents in India- 2020' report released by the government this year, said. Over 72% of accidents and 67% of fatalities took place under sunny or clear weather in 2020, it added.

372.title: Celsius becomes 3rd major crypto firm to file for bankruptcy in 3 weeks
372.article_body: Celsius has become the third major crypto firm to file for bankruptcy in three weeks following the collapse of hedge fund Three Arrows Capital and broker Voyager Digital. The crypto lender said the decision was part of a financial restructuring that would "stabilise the business". The US-based platform had suspended customer withdrawals, swaps and transfers citing "extreme market conditions".

373.title: No concept of 'super CM' in present govt: Maha Dy CM Fadnavis
373.article_body: Maharashtra Deputy CM Devendra Fadnavis on Friday said that there was no concept of "super CM" in the present Eknath Shinde-led government. "We have only one chief minister and that is Eknath Shinde. We are working under his leadership," Fadnavis said. His comment comes after some opposition leaders claimed that though Shinde is the CM, Fadnavis was taking the decisions.

374.title: Federal Bank's profit jumps 63% y-o-y to ₹600 crore, share price rises
374.article_body: The share price of private sector lender Federal Bank rose by 1.54% to ₹98.80 after it reported a 63.5% increase in net profit in the April-June quarter to ₹600.66 crore. The bank had reported a profit of ₹367 crore in the same period last year. Meanwhile, its net interest income rose by 13% to ₹1,604.5 crore.

375.title: Villagers yet to cremate body of Haryana farmer who died on July 8
375.article_body: The body of Dharampal, a farmer from Haryana's Hisar district who died in a clash with policemen on July 8, is yet to be cremated. Villagers refused to cremate him and protested against the arrest of four villagers in connection with the violence. Last week's clash erupted over the sale rights of fly ash generated from a nearby thermal plant.

376.title: India provides 3,000 tents as disaster relief material to Nepal
376.article_body: India on Friday handed over consignments of flood and disaster relief material to Nepal as part of its efforts to build a disaster-resilient country. The relief materials included 3,000 tents and ten motor inflatable boats, according to a statement from the Indian Embassy. Nepal's Home Minister Bal Krishna Khand thanked India for the timely delivery of the relief material.

377.title: Shreyas Talpade to be part of Kangana Ranaut's 'Emergency': Report
377.article_body: Actor Shreyas Talpade will be a part of actress Kangana Ranaut's upcoming film 'Emergency' in which she will portray late Prime Minister Indira Gandhi, as per reports. Kangana has produced the film under her production house Manikarnika Films and will also be directing it. She had earlier directed 2019 film 'Manikarnika: The Queen of Jhansi' which also stars Ankita Lokhande.

378.title: States' fiscal deficit may rise to ₹8.4 lakh cr due to high capex: ICRA
378.article_body: States' fiscal deficit may rise to ₹8.4 lakh crore as they've budgeted 36% higher capital expenditure during 2022-23, an ICRA report said. As many as 26 large states, except Assam, have spent ₹5 lakh crore in capex, a 34% rise from FY20, it added. In budget estimates, these states have pegged their revenue receipts at ₹35.8 lakh crore.

379.title: Mehbooba's sister identifies Yasin Malik as 1 of her kidnappers in 1989 case
379.article_body: Rubaiya Sayeed, sister of Peoples Democratic Party (PDP) chief Mehbooba Mufti, has identified Kashmiri separatist leader Yasin Malik and three others as her kidnappers, officials said. Rubaiya appeared before a Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) court on Friday in a case related to her abduction by Jammu and Kashmir Liberation Front (JKLF) on December 8, 1989.

380.title: RBI likely to introduce new rules for fintech firms: Report
380.article_body: The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) is likely to announce new regulations for fintech companies, Moneycontrol reported. The rules will likely cover areas such as data sharing, privacy, compliance with KYC and anti-money laundering norms, the report said. This comes in the wake of complaints related to some fintechs charging usurious interest rates and other issues, the report added.

381.title: Govt will promote chess in schools and colleges: Odisha CM
381.article_body: Odisha CM Naveen Patnaik on Friday said his government will promote chess in schools and colleges. His comment comes after he handed the Chess Olympiad relay torch to Padmini Rout at a function in Bhubaneswar's Lokaseva Bhavan. It's a proud moment for India as it is hosting such an international event in the 75th year of Independence, Patnaik added.

382.title: Man kills 19-year-old daughter over love affair in UP's Firozabad
382.article_body: Police said that a man, identified as Manoj Rathore, allegedly killed his 19-year-old daughter in Uttar Pradesh's Firozabad by slitting her throat over her love affair with a man. The accused was taken into custody and the weapon he used in the crime was recovered, police said. The body has been sent for a postmortem, SP (Rural) Akhilesh Narayan said.

383.title: Lakhs of Iraqi cleric's followers gather in show of strength
383.article_body: Lakhs of Iraqi cleric Moqtada al-Sadr's followers gathered in the streets of Baghdad for a prayer on Friday in a show of strength to his political rivals. Sadr has vowed to disband powerful Iraqi militia groups loyal to Iran and to hold corrupt Iraqi politicians to account. Earlier, Sadr's attempt to form a government free of Iran-backed parties had failed.

384.title: RSS worker beaten up by police in UP's Bareilly, 10 booked
384.article_body: At least ten policemen were booked and one of them suspended after an RSS worker was allegedly beaten up following a road rage incident in Uttar Pradesh's Bareilly. According to RSS worker Aryanendra Kumar, he was beaten up by Sub-Inspector Ankit Kumar when he couldn't give space for the policeman's vehicle to pass. Ankit Kumar was suspended after the incident.

385.title: All 16 teams to feature in men's T20 World Cup 2022 confirmed, ICC share list
385.article_body: Netherlands and Zimbabwe have booked their place in ICC men's T20 World Cup 2022 after winning their semi-finals of Global Qualifier B. With this, all 16 teams to qualify for the tournament have been confirmed. Ireland and UAE qualified from Global Qualifier A, while top 11 teams from the men's T20 World Cup 2021 and hosts Australia had already qualified.

386.title: Man beheads wife, walks 12 km with her head to Odisha police station
386.article_body: A 55-year-old man allegedly beheaded his wife after suspecting her of having illicit relations in Odisha's Dhenkanal. As per reports, Nakaphodi Majhi walked 12 km to Gondia Police Station with his wife's severed head to surrender on Friday. Locals reportedly captured him while he was en route to the station. Police have recovered the blood-stained weapon used in the crime.

387.title: Heroin worth ₹3 crore seized from fuel tank of car in Assam; 1 held
387.article_body: Assam Police on Friday seized around 470 grams of heroin worth around ₹3-4 crore and has arrested a drug peddler in this connection in Karimganj district. The contraband was seized from a fuel tank of a car. According to Karimganj SP, an operation was launched after they received information that the consignment of drugs was coming from Mizoram.

388.title: I just wanted to act: Manish on being a successful actor after 20 years
388.article_body: Speaking about being successful after 20 years of his career, actor Manish Chaudhari said he never thought about success in a commercial sense. "I just wanted to act. OTT platforms gave an actor opportunities to do their job sincerely and bring their audience to them," he added. Manish said he looks at his characters and tries to understand their conflicts.

389.title: I wish I'd get a role like 'Padmaavat', 'Bajirao Mastani': Sai Pallavi
389.article_body: Actress Sai Pallavi has stated that she has seen a few films which made her wish to get a role like that. "I have seen 'Padmaavat' and 'Bajirao Mastani' and sometimes you will think so," the actress added. She further said that she felt satisfied doing 'Shyam Singha Roy' in which she played someone from a different time.

390.title: Pune activists allege discrepancies in poll papers of Maha CM
390.article_body: Two Pune-based activists have moved a court to register an offence against Maharashtra Chief Minister Eknath Shinde, alleging discrepancies in his affidavits filed for legislative assembly polls in the past. The discrepancies pertain to the declaration of movable and immovable assets of Shinde, according to the activists. Shinde is a four-time legislator from Kopri Pachpakhadi constituency.

391.title: ED seizes cash worth ₹11.88 crore from Jharkhand CM's aide, others
391.article_body: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) on Friday said it has seized cash worth ₹11.88 crore from 37 bank accounts belonging to Pankaj Mishra, a close aide of Jharkhand CM Hemant Soren, among others, in a money laundering case. According to the agency, the cash came from illegal mining in multiple places, including Sahibganj, which is CM Soren's constituency.

392.title: CMs of Assam & Arunachal Pradesh sign pact to resolve border dispute
392.article_body: Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma and his Arunachal Pradesh counterpart Pema Khandu on Friday signed an agreement to resolve the border dispute between the two states. "We've decided to restrict the 'disputed villages' to 86 instead of 123," Sarma said. "Based on our present boundary, we'll try to resolve the rest by 15 Sept 2022," he added.

393.title: 9 motorcycles destroyed in fire in Pune residential parking
393.article_body: Nine motorcycles were destroyed in a fire at a residential complex's parking lot in Pune's Chandannagar locality on Thursday. No casualties were reported. "The exact reason for the fire is not known. However, prima facie...the fire broke out in the electricity meters installed in the parking lot," fire duty officer Tandel Sunil Devkar said.

394.title: How has Kohli performed in int'l cricket since his last hundred 965 days ago?
394.article_body: Ex-Team India captain Virat Kohli has gone 965 days without scoring an international hundred. Since his last international hundred which came on November 23, 2019, Kohli has scored 2,537 runs in 78 international innings across formats at an average of 35.73. He has hit 24 fifties, with highest score of 94*(50) that came in a T20I on December 6, 2019.

395.title: Roger Federer calls me 'Quack': World no. 74 James Duckworth
395.article_body: World number 74 James Duckworth has revealed that 20-time Grand Slam champion Roger Federer calls him "Quack". He added, "We were playing at the Australian Open [2014] one year and it often happens as well, the quacking in the crowd and he thought that it was pretty funny. So that's what he calls me." Notably, Duckworth is known as "Ducks".

396.title: Chinese Prez Xi Jinping visits Xinjiang for 1st time since 2014
396.article_body: Chinese President Xi Jinping visited Xinjiang region this week for the first time since 2014. Xi called Xinjiang a "core area and hub" in Belt and Road Initiative that seeks to better connect China's economy to Central Asia and Eastern Europe, state media reported. Notably, Xi's visit comes amid accusations by critics of a crackdown on Uighur Muslims in Xinjiang.

397.title: BJP shares alleged pic of ex-VP Ansari at event with Pak journalist, Ansari denies
397.article_body: Former Vice-President Hamid Ansari has reiterated that he never knew Pakistani journalist Nusrat Mirza after BJP shared a picture purportedly showing him sharing a stage with Mirza. BJP spokesperson Gaurav Bhatia alleged that the picture showed Ansari and Mirza at an Indian conference in 2009. Mirza, who's claimed to have spied for ISI, alleged Ansari shared "classified" information with him.

398.title: RSS means love for nation: Giriraj Singh on Patna SSP's PFI remark
398.article_body: After Patna SSP Manavjit Singh drew parallels between Islamic extremist outfit Popular Front of India (PFI) and Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh (RSS), Union Minister Giriraj Singh tweeted, "RSS means love for the nation, RSS means welfare of the nation, RSS means service to the nation...RSS means humanity and harmony." He added, "Every sensible person…understands this, except a few who've an agenda."

399.title: Every innings is going to pile up pressure: Jaffer after Kohli's 16 at Lord's
399.article_body: Speaking about Virat Kohli's poor form, Wasim Jaffer stated that every innings is going to pile up pressure on him and probably put doubts in him. "People keep reminding him. I'm sure it adds up...if he had played those T20Is [against West Indies], he would've been in touch," he added. Kohli scored 16(25) against England in second ODI at Lord's.

400.title: Govt shares symptoms of monkeypox as India reports its first case
400.article_body: After India's first monkeypox case was reported in Kerala on Thursday, government shared a list of monkeypox symptoms. Listing common symptoms, which include fever and skin rashes, government said, "Individuals who have history of exposure to a suspected/confirmed case of monkeypox in the last 21 days should monitor their health and should seek medical attention if they exhibit these symptoms."

401.title: Adani Ports to buy Israel's Haifa Port with local firm for $1.18 bn
401.article_body: Adani Ports and Special Economic Zone have won a bid to acquire Israel's Haifa Port with local firm Gadot Group for $1.18 billion, Israel announced on Thursday. Adani Ports and Special Economic Zone will have a 70% stake and Gadot will hold the remaining 30%. Adani Ports said the acquisition will boost trade lanes with its Indian ports.
